author: {'steamid': '76561198986459373', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13863, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13820, 'last_played': 1702160762}
review: It used to be fun, but lately with a lot of people using the the Oculus controllers that enable you to shoot so fast that it is no longer a game of skill where the scores are meaningless. And some will just shoot what you are trying to shoot. You can enable not to have rapid fire when starting a multi player game, but jumping into most game you will have to deal with it and its not fun, except for those doing it. The Devs. have the power to reduce it down to a manageable level, just enable all the time instead of making it a choice. It's just like a glitch in the system that is often fixed by the Devs

review: This was more difficult than I thought it would be, but they do have an element of upgrading your hero/weapons. That to me is where the only replay value is. You can only teleport to other towers within the level for new vantage points, but I found myself accidentally doing this from time to time. This isn't a traditional tower defense, meaning I didn't notice any building/upgrading assistance on the battlefield., but find some friends to play online, and it may play easier. Worth a shot. Price tag is $19.99 (as of Aug 2023), but recommend getting on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198154004822', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 312, 'playtime_forever': 433, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 433, 'last_played': 1685731494}
review:
[b] Sein Wohnzimmer gegen eine Anstürmende Orkhorde mit einem Bogen verteidigen. Top.  [/b] 

[h1] Pro: [/h1] 
- Super VR-Titel
- Einfach, aber meine Freunde und ich hatten viel Spaß die unterschiedlichen Tore zu verteidigen
- Auch in Maßen für Motion Sickness anfällige

[h1] Für Erfolgsjäger: [/h1]   
Für die 100% müsst ihr sehr lange spielen. Die meisten Erfolge staffeln sich, heißt 10, 100, 1000 Orks usw. abschießen. Vor allem der mit den Fensterschuss ist blöd, da es nur eine Fensterkarte gibt. 

[h1] Fazit[/h1]
Ein klasse VR-Game, dass sein Geld wert war. Es ist einfach gehalten, sprich ihr habt wirklich nur euren Bogen und schießt auf Orks. Daraus besteht das ganze Spiel. Aber wer so was mag, ist hier richtig.

author: {'steamid': '76561197966801020', 'num_games_owned': 781, 'num_reviews': 91, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1687201260}
review:
What a piece of garbage. The maps are horrible, half the time it feels you can't even get a straight shot because the shooting points are so far apart and hardly cover the lanes on which the enemies approach. Extras like cannons and catapults hinder your view more than they provide actual usability. The enemies are hard to hit due to their realistic proportions or freaking arrow sponges. It's easy to shoot between legs for example. There is no tutorial, you're thrusted into the game without an explanation or a short phase for you to check where the shooting points actually are. Without updates you're hardly able to survive five waves. Even with weapons updates i don't think there will be much fun to be had for the average player. This is more for the "real" gamer i guess...? So yea, if you just want a fun little tower defense bow game, STAY AWAY.

In general VR terms: Spells didn't work on my Pico 4 headset and there is no way to reposition yourself within your play area (my game driftet off for some reason).

What's especially frustrating: There are so many great tower defense games and Valve itself presented a blueprint for a bow-and-arrow game for free in the VR labs. As such it's unbelieveable how bad this game is in comparison.

author: {'steamid': '76561198012204927', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 72, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 162, 'last_played': 1698528477}
review:
Das Spiel ist ein ziemlicher Wave Grinder, mit Betonung auf Grinder.

Die Spielmechaniken (Bogen) sind noch ok, aber es fühlt sich weitaus unnatürlicher an als bei Spitzentiteln wie InDeath.
Gegener sind jetzt auch nicht wirklich abwechslungsreich, aber es gibt diverse Umgebungen die alle einen gleichbleibenden Stil haben.
Wenn es einem nicht langweilig wird, kann man lange spielen. Wär toll wenn es dafür mehr Errungenschaften gäbe, die und die schwer freizuspielenden Bögen/Ausrüstung, sind die eigentlich die einzigen Gründe überhaupt weiter zu spielen.
Für das Gebotene IMO aktuell zu teuer.

author: {'steamid': '76561199103659312', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 17334, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 90, 'last_played': 1703376405}
review:
Zeit für ein kleines Update (ein noch aktuelleres, eher kritisch, ganz unten), nachdem ich einige Stunden mehr mit dem Spiel verbracht habe. Ich schreibe alles was aktuell ist, in Doppelklammern zwischen die ursprüngliche Rezi. (( ... ))


Witziges Game. Man steht auf Türmen und schießt mit Pfeil und Bogen auf Orks und Drachen. Wenn man die lahmen ersten Runden hinter sich gebracht hat, wird es anstrengend und witzig. Denn die Orks können einem auch etwas entgegen schleudern (eine Axt? - ((ja, es sind Äxte)) ), und die Drachen mit Feuer töten - man muss also ausweichen (sich ducken oder auf einen anderen Turm beamen - Letzteres habe ich noch nicht getestet, scheint aber die einzige Möglichkeit zu sein, den Feuerdrachen zu entkommen ((- der Feuerdrache muss abgeschossen werden. Da ich ihn anfangs scheinbar nie getroffen habe, habe ich auch nie den Schadensbalken gesehen. Darum dachte ich, man muss ihm ausweichen und kann ihn nicht töten. Das war ein Irrtum. Schießt man ihn nicht ab, wird er einen töten und ins Haus eindringen)) - ((anstrengend wird das Spiel irgendwann nicht mehr so sehr. Trifft man schneller und besser, muss man auch Äxten weniger ausweichen. Man kann natürlich dennoch eine Art Workout aus dem Spiel machen, indem man seine Schießmechanik entsprechend anwendet, und absichtlich so spielt, das die Orks einen bewerfen. Und ins Schwitzen kommt man ab einem gewissen Level dann auf jeden Fall doch)) ). Mit jeder Runde werden es mehr und sie werden schneller ((bzw. braucht man mehrere Treffer, um sie zu besiegen)). Wie in anderen TD-Spielen auch. 

Pfeil und Bogen können aufgerüstet werden, man kann auch Heiltränke oder sowas kaufen. Der Standardbogen ist aber auch schon ziemlich cool und nützlich. Bin gespannt, inwieweit sich die power  verbessert ((Scheinbar gar nicht. Was sich ändert, ist allerdings die Chance auf mehr kritische Treffer, die Orks zu vereisen, mehr XP oder Gold oder ähnliches. Der Pfeil an sich wird aber nicht stärker oder schneller, was aber nicht tragisch ist. Denn er funktioniert ausreichend gut und es gibt ja die erwähnten anderen Boni.)) 

Möglich sind Einzelspielerrunden ((Mit Ranking-System)) und online Spiele (man kann einfach in ein schon stattfindendes Spiel beitreten und spart sich so mitunter auch die ersten Runden - oder selbst eins erstellen ((co-op und pvp sind möglich)) ). Habe mehrere  Gruppen finden können, das Spiel wird also auch gespielt. Und macht mit anderen mehr Spaß.

((Es wäre schön, wenn man mit späteren Runden beginnen könnte und nicht immer bei Runde 1 beginnen muss. Einfach weil ich persönlich nicht immer die Zeit und Lust habe, mich durch den "langweiligen" Part zu kämpfen. 

Der Mix der Feinde ist an sich okay. Es könnten aber ein paar spaßige Orks mit eingebaut werden. Zum Beispiel welche, die (irrsinnig schnell) springen oder Purzelbäume machen, oder sich in der Luft drehen/durch die Erde bohren - irgendwas, was es schwerer macht sie zu treffen. Aber eben auch lustiger. Vielleicht müssen sie ja nicht zwingend großen Schaden anrichten, aber es gibt dann eine besondere Belohnung, wenn man sie trifft. Zum Beispiel der Heilungsbalken des Hauses geht wieder nach oben - oder sowas.  Und Bonuspunkte für denjenigen, der getroffen hat.  Das würde mehr Abwechslung in das Spiel bringen. 

Die Plattform auf der man steht, könnte sich bewegen, was die Schwierigkeit des Spieles erhöht. 

In anderen Rezensionen wurde vorgeschlagen, verschiedene Zeiten/Wetter einzubauen. Das wäre in der Tat sehr spannend, vor allem wenn es sich innerhalb einer Runde ändern würde. Es wird dunkel, die Orks leuchten an gewissen Stellen - es wird schwieriger, aber auch spannender, sie zu treffen. Oder die Orks tragen irgendwas mit sich rum, und wenn man das ausversehen trifft, wird Nebel ausgelöst. Oder ein kurzer Sturm - die Pfeile fliegen also ins "Unsichtbare" oder werden vom Wind woanders hin getragen. Oder ein plötzlicher, unvorbereiteter Stellungswechsel. Da gäbe es wahnsinnig viele Möglichkeiten, um den doch eher gleichbleibenden Ablauf etwas ins Chaotische und Ungewisse zu bringen. Andererseits hat man in höheren Wellen dann genug zu tun :) . )) 

(Was die Community betrifft, habe ich oft das Gefühl, dass es eher ein Gegeneinander, statt Miteinander ist ((ganz anders als im Spiel "After The Fall", wo man zu viert Horden von Zombies bekämpft und es immer sehr kooperativ zugeht)). An sich ist das Ziel möglichst hohe Wellen zu erreichen in dem man zusammen arbeitet. Es springen aber sehr oft Leute ab, wenn jemand besser spielt als sie oder mehr Punkte erreichen ((das kann man im Verlauf des Spieles schon sehen, ist aber auch vom Turm abhängig, auf welchem man steht. Es gibt manche Türme, die anderen überlegen sind)). Oder sie legen ihre Headsets nieder und "streiken".  Selbst wenn man ganz langsam und angepasst spielt ((man sieht im Spiel, welche Stufe die Mitspieler im Spiel erreicht haben und weiß dann auch, wie viel Zeit sie mit diesem verbrachten)), absichtlich daneben trifft, die anderen machen lässt und erst eingreift, wenn die Orks das Tor stürmen wollen. Ich verstehe es nicht. Zumal es die Möglichkeit des privaten Spieles gibt, wo kein Fremder dann stört. 
Wie auch immer, von den Spielern die besser sind, als man selbst, kann man eine Menge lernen. Auch wenn es ärgerlich sein kann, wenn sie mehr und schneller treffen. Mit höheren Wellen werden auch sie genug zu tun haben und es bleiben auch Orks für einen selbst übrig. Also einfach weiter machen und man wird sich sehr schnell verbessern und mithalten können... Und dann macht es extrem viel Spaß und wird ein schönes Workout.) 

Wenn man alleine spielt, kann man gut Musik dabei hören. Meine Favoriten, die sehr gut passen, wie ich finde:

Feuerschwanz - Warriors of the world (alternativ das Original von Manowar)
Wind Rose - Diggy, Diggy Hole
Blackbriar - I'd Rather Burn, Snow White And Rose Red 
Ruelle - War Of Hearts
Bring Me The Horizon - Kingslayer
Halestorm - I Miss The Misery
usw. 
Metall/Rock mit Krieger- und Elfenstimmen, passt. :)

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Seitdem Update, welches ein Zusammenspiel zwischen Quest und Steam ermöglicht, ist das Spiel nur noch bedingt zu empfehlen. Jetzt gibt es zwar jede Menge Spieler, aber sehr, sehr viele die das Gameplay missbrauchen. Durch falsche Anwendung der Controller, können sie extrem schnell schießen - über das gewöhnliche Maß hinaus. Ein Boss ist damit innerhalb von Sekunden erledigt, wo man gewöhnlich schon ein wenig Anstrengung braucht, um ihn zu besiegen. Mit anderen Worten, auf diese Weise ist das Spiel extrem langweilig. Mit fester Gruppe - okay. Mit etwas Glück, niemanden in einer öffentlichen Gruppe zu haben, der so spielt - auch okay. Muss man also selbst wissen, ob man nur in festen Gruppen spielen mag, oder sich ewig auf die Suche nach einer Partie begibt, in welcher sogenannter "Maschinengewehrmissbrauch" nicht stattfindet. Schade. Sehr schade um das Spiel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198884124394', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1672709637}
review:
A ver, el juego es entretenido, pero pareciera que fué desarrollado en 1 semana. Los enemigos tienen aspecto de "descargar pack de orcos gratis 3D" con 1 sola animación de correr y 1 animación de morir. 
No solo eso, la mecánica del arco, que es la ÚNICA y la mas importante, está pobremente desarrollada. Tenés que tirar la mano muy hacia atrás donde el Oculus no detecta el control, por lo que es normal un movimiento errático en la mano y por lo tanto una pesima puntería. 

Además las hitbox de los personajes es cualquier cosa, jugando pvp hay varias flechas que tendrían que matar al enemigo pero lo atraviesan como si estuviese hecho de aire.

El juego ni siquiera tiene modo historia!

Mil veces mejor el juego de arco y flecha de "The Lab" que es gratuito, la única ventaja de éste es que se puede jugar coop.

review: интересная игра, особенно хорошо идёт как кардио упражнения, количество приседаний больше, чем в любой другой игре (из тех, что играл). Ну и долгая прокачка перса может затянуть на многие часы игры. Игра быстро надоедает, если играть одному, поэтому открытые сервера очень помогают, там и пообщаться можно и прокачать быстрее, в любом случае именно в данной игре вместе легче и интереснее

author: {'steamid': '76561198306306126', 'num_games_owned': 870, 'num_reviews': 139, 'playtime_forever': 3981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1319, 'last_played': 1672595701}
review:
We need a thumb across.  I'm kinda middle-of-the-road with this game... but barely edging towards approval. 
It is super simplistic.  Aiming takes a lot of getting used to.  And it SEEMS to have been mostly abandoned... at least on Steam. 

It has a few of the rarest achievements on Steam, which is what baited me into playing in the first place...   only to find that all the achievements are a monolithic grind of horrifying proportions.   
HOWEVER if you don't mind grind, or don't really care and just want a game to pick up, put down, and play whenever... it is fine.  Nothing special, but not awful either.  
It just takes some getting used to.

author: {'steamid': '76561198125859790', 'num_games_owned': 67, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1682928198}

review: This is a great game.  Really makes you feel like Legolas blasting orcs with your bow.  It doesn't try to do too much and isn't overly complicated.  Just simple clean fun blasting orcs. author: {'steamid': '76561198994071879', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 7064, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5257, 'last_played': 1710038974}
review:
UPDATE: 6/30/2023......Cross Platform play is live and it works!!!  Played last night on my steam account using my index with my GF on her Oculus Quest (whatever facebook or Meta or whatever that company goes by....their vr headset).  THANK YOU DEVS !!!!  Huge update.  Cant wait for your next game

Fun game, good exercise, re-playable....NEEDS CROSS PLATFORM PLAY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  I BOUGHT THIS GAME TWICE, ONCE FOR ME ON STEAM AND ONCE FOR MY GF ON OCULUS, ONLY TO FIND OUT WE CANT PLAY TOGETHER BECAUSE ONLINE CO-OP DOES NOT MEAN CROSSPLAY.  NOW I KNOW (WE DO NOT HAVE A 2ND PC TO USE THE OCULUS LINK).

All that said, I do enjoy the game and would recommend.  Decent work out when you get to the later levels.  Not super fun solo but when you play with others online it can be a lot of fun.  

GIVE US CROSSPLAY PLEASE !

PSS.  If i'm wrong about the crossplay between steam and meta (oculus) then please let me know and I will update this review.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968190723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1231, 'last_played': 1708815279}

author: {'steamid': '76561197976310562', 'num_games_owned': 920, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1664948389}
review:
Haven't played much, but my first impressions are a solid "bleh".  The archery works, and that's it.  I can feel like there's a game here that's fun but everything about it is so bland.  The orcs might as well be paper cut-outs they are so characterless.  The areas are OK but lack any sort of visual flair.  The lighting is full-bright overhead, the...  

Just like the devs, I can't be bothered to get any deeper into this.  If this wasn't VR, it would have sank into the pool of tepid mediocre porridge that is so much of the Steam market.  This looks like an asset flip and plays like a $1 tower defence knock-off game.  

Don't bother with this, it's not worth it.
developer_response:
We are sorry that the solutions that are implemented in our game do not suit your taste. We recommend giving the game a second chance. Have you tried the PvP mode? 
Best Regards
Matthias. Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198333600616', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 25758, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25693, 'last_played': 1667110784}
review: 都好几年了，官方还不能对PVP模式进行修复么，到2022年还有人能开挂在半空和别人打PVP，这样太没意思了。是不是太没效率了，一点都不考虑玩家的感受。这根本不是比拼弓箭技术，纯粹是谁开挂谁厉害。

author: {'steamid': '76561198127831948', 'num_games_owned': 308, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1664513602}
review: It's a very fun game to start. I want there to be a campaign. With levels, with new unlocks along the way. This will be a great game if they follow the community and perhaps even allow mods down the road. But so far not a bad tower defense. Good concept, I think alot of the problem comes with the adaptation of other VR controllers. I personally with the INDEX, think it worked fine but needs some work with control scheme pages and such. The game play is fun. Almost a beat Saber workout if you put in the work in rapid firing the Bow like the guys screaming "their breaking in!" Isn't bad enough. The game is fun just play it😆

author: {'steamid': '76561198019649839', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1192, 'last_played': 1674582373}
review: Great game to play with random people. Everyone has been really nice and helpful too. You can also stay quiet and co-op in silence. It's a bow and arrow game with a wave format, an escort & pvp servers too. Each with different strategies and a good amount of maps to choose from with gear upgrades and spells to level up and learn.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970329732', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 196, 'playtime_forever': 17, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1663272498}
review:
I thought the game starting today was no longer early access, but it says early access inside the game.

Feels like a boring wave shooter, and I only care for singleplayer. Bow handling is awfully bad - see Visby Archer for how it's done. Graphics need an update - the mission where you protect the dwarves looked Questified, no shadows, low poly count. 

The game does have a great concept, but I'm refunding for now. 

Btw, performance was great - got solid 90 fps using Index res 500% - which also confirms that devs have plenty of headroom to improve graphics. Especially animations could be much better and did not look real.

We are sorry that the solutions that are implemented in our game do not suit your taste. We recommend giving the game a second chance. Have you tried the PvP mode?

Matthias. Wenkly Studio

review: 目前买了4个月的VR眼镜最喜欢的游戏，但这个联机跟不联机完全是两个难度，我很奇怪为什么美服、欧服和亚服一个也连不，你要说没有加速器，PAYDAY我也没有加速，连的很好啊，这个却连服务器也看不见，有人解决了这个问题吗？加速器没有这个游戏的选项/

author: {'steamid': '76561198985266809', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1644478289}
review:
Нейтрально. Своих денег (360 р. на момент написания обзора) не стоит, по скидке - в принципе можно брать. Друг уже писал обзор на эту игру - разработчики забили болт, на просьбы решить проблему с Index (он сам разобрался, в итоге) - игнорят; это, так сказать, характеризует... Умиляют фразы в восторженных обзорах типа: "Это качественный VR, стрельба только из лука, приятная графика", "Играть можно всей семьей"... Графика даже на 2018й, когда этот кекс писал обзор, была "на отеб-сь", а в 2021 смотрится откровенно убого; блин, эти уряклы вообще видели некоторые карты для PavlovVR? Типа "VICE"? Которые клепают "на коленке" любители... Где, наваливающиеся на ворота воины, разлетающиеся во все стороны, когда ворота проломлены, где крушащие стены тролли, где полуголые визжащие эльфийки, разбегающиеся от орков? Ладно, чёрт с этим, но где, блядь, нормальные текстуры и хоть малость качественные 3D модели??? Хоть бы какой CGI-ролик (проматываемый) добавили... Я понимаю, что расчёт и на слабые компы (хотя ПММ нищебродам не зачем покупать VR чтоб потом плакаться на высокие требования), и попытка сэкономить, но бляха, с 2016го года можно было хоть что-то из этого запилить? Или выпустить какой-нибудь ДелюксАпдейтДЛС? "Играть можно всей семьёй..." - дык и в "Аризону..." можно. Купите 2 системника и 2 комплекта ВР только. Если у вас семья из двух человек. "Должны быть у каждого обладателя шлема и хоть когда-то желающего пострелять из лука", ""На город наших союзников напали враги..." И мы теперь спешим на помощь и учимся стрелять из лука"... У каждого, хоть когда-то желающего пострелять из лука - должен быть лук. "Физически", не виртуально. И никуда мы не спешим, а стоим, как дятел иждём очередную волну. Сколько их вообще, люди? Я пока дожил до 13й. Они бесконечные???
Ко всему - в игре на редкость кривая экономика. Со стартовым луком и без заклинаний вы не продержитесь до 11й волны, хоть бы вы и 700летний эльф-снайпер, как воспринимает себя один из обзорщиков. За бой - 20-30 монет, заклинания - количественно расходуемые, нормальный лук - 1000 монет... что с вами, разрабы??? Ладно, я, кхм... короче полезные программы имеются, купил амуницию получше - всё равно дожил только до 13й волны. А если играть стандартно? Дроч-ь одну катку за каткой по 10 раз, чтобы купить лук? Не знаю, пока, что там в мультиплеере, но сингл - именно такой. Русский язык (как и другие)( не удосужиться добавить за 5 лет, при том, что нуждается в переводе голимый текст - это просто кринж. Единственное - руки неплохо разминаются. В общем ставлю плюс, авансом, но имейте в виду оговорки.

review:
The single player mode is a bit boring. Multiplayer could be fun, but friends with the Quest version can't play with me.

There should be cross-platform multiplayer! 

I know it's "Early Access" but it's been in this state since 2016!
developer_response:
Hi!

Thank you for your feedback.
We apologize for the late response.

Due to the fact that Oculus Quest does not have as much power as PC, creating a consistent crossplatform between these versions has become quite a challenge.
Our team is still working on this subject and trying to find a good solution.
Nevertheless, as of today, I can't promise if such a crossplatform will be developed and if so, what form it will take.

Best Regards,
Matthias, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198295182413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1639850184}
review:
Meh. I want to like it, but the game feels very "strange". Things are both too big and too small at the same time:
- World scale makes it feel like you're 4 ft tall (I'm not actually 4 ft tall).
- The maps are not that big, yet the slow arrows make it feel like everything is very far away.
- Enemies also move pretty slowly (surely for difficulty reasons), which makes landmarks feel far apart.
- Shading is flat, so it feels like there is no depth cuing (pretty important for a shooter, right?)
developer_response:
Hi! 
Thank you for your feedback even though it is negative. 

Despite your negative feelings about the scale of the game, we would like you to consider playing the multiplayer mode. 
It gives you the possibility to play Co-op or a more dynamic PvP deathmatch, which you might enjoy more. 

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

developer_response:
Hi! 
Thank you for your feedback, even though it is negative. 

I would like to suggest you play the multiplayer mode. It offers different content than the single-player mode. In addition, you can join a deathmatch PvP game in which you compete against other players.

author: {'steamid': '76561198811272273', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 952, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1633154286}
review:
I think the concept is good, but the game is a bit buggy in its current state. Hitboxes are extremely inaccurate at times. It's frustrating losing to a wave when you watch several arrows shoot directly through the enemy. It feels a bit like a beta in its current release, but if the developers continue to work on it, it could be a great game.

EDIT: To the developer response, this has been occurring mainly for the demon-looking characters and not for the orcs.
developer_response:
Hi! 
Thank you for your feedback despite it being negative. 
Regarding the problem, you are talking about. Sometimes an arrow may fly right past an orc, and then he runs into the arrow trail, which looks like the arrow went through him. I hope I managed to explain this, and it is understandable. 
Best regards, 
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561197997122728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 79, 'last_played': 1626623815}
review: The core is solid but to me it feels like there's 60% or so of the game missing. Feels strangely empty after going through the first couple of waves.
developer_response:
Hi! 
Thank you for your feedback even though it is negative. 

We recommend you to try the multiplayer mode. It contains significantly more content. You will experience new maps with different mechanics and more interesting enemies. Moreover, multiplayer also offers a more dynamic deathmatch PvP mode in which you can compete with other players instead of cooperating with them. 

In the end, I would like to add that we are constantly working on Elven Assassin and enriching it with new content with each update. I hope you will give Elven Assassin a second chance and change your opinion about our game. 

Best regards, Kamil
Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198028431850', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 51, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1629059679}
review:
I'm not sure how this game is so positively reviewed. Quite honestly, I don't think it would have met my expectations even back when the HTC Vive first launched, much less in 2021. It feels very thrown together and "tech demo-y" rather than a full fledged, thought out game. The biggest problem is that is is incredibly repetitive. Each level is 1 or more ships arriving full of enemies, who then exit on the beach and make their way to your gate. Later levels may have more ships and more enemies, but they're the same enemies level after level after level. Other than an axe throwing Orc thrown in every now and then, none of the enemies pose any threat at all other than their ability to reach your gate. They don't attack you, they don't move in different ways, they don't take cover or randomize their paths, they don't change their behavior at all. Once you've seen one level, you've seen them all because virtually nothing changes after 40 minutes of play. It's just more and more of the same. It feels like a very early tower defense mobile game, just ported to VR. Then, there is the problem of the bow mechanics. The bow "feels" fine, but the game mechanics reward poor play and punish realistic archery. You can quickly pull the string back a few inches and let go and it works just as well as if you held the bow and drew back as you would in real life. Sure, the game gives you a bonus for headshots, but the reward is so little that it's not worth bothering, because you're much better spamming dozens of arrows as quickly as possible instead. So the entire thing devolves into trying to quickly shoot a barrage of arrows, rather than spending the time to shoot skillfully. Also, somehow wooden arrows can destroy the wooden ships that enemies arrive on. Not sure how that makes any sense, but it's how the game works. Other than shooting the enemies, there is literally nothing else to do in the levels. Even Valve's tech demo of Longbow had options of shooting oil cauldrons and exploding barrels, but I found nothing like that here. Eventually you earn points and/or gold that you can use to buy spells to make your attacks stronger or new bows and helms to change your appearance. However, this system is implemented poorly. You don't get to actually spend any of your earned points/gold until after you fail a level or quit. So you can easily play for 45 minutes doing the exact same thing over and over with zero reward. The game should have implemented a system every 5 levels to allow you to change your abilities. Additionally, the different helms do nothing at all. They are purely for appearance and nothing more.

The gaming of the shooting system combined with repetitive and uninteresting enemies, boring levels, and nonsensical mechanics make this game not worth the time spent to download it. It could be good, but needs a lot of improvements to even reach the level of free tech demos created 5 years ago.
developer_response:
Hi! 
Thank you so much for your review, even though it was negative. 

I want to assure you that we are still working on Elven Assassin and adding new content.

As for the current content, I recommend you to try other maps. Some of them offer new mechanics and interesting enemies which you won't find anywhere else. Additionally, we recommend trying out the PvP deathmatch mode, which is much more dynamic than the standard PvE mode. 

We hope that you will give Elven Assassin a second chance and change your opinion about this game. 

Best regards, 
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561197971072413', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1622700081}
review:
[b] I make video reviews which can be seen with this link if you prefer a video format. Otherwise, continue to read my script down below. https://youtu.be/Gsnk-NtU458 [/b]

[b] The Good Stuff [/b]

This archery tower defense-style game has you shooting arrows into various enemy types who approach your main castle gates.

The objective is simple, and you're role is to kill the enemy before they reach the gate. If they go through the gate, your castles health goes down, and once it reaches zero it is game over. Elven Assassin has a single player mode, or you can group with up to 3 other players to help you survive each wave of enemies. Waves become progressively more difficult, and later waves start to introduce more difficult enemy types.

[b] Mechanics [/b]

If we talk about the mechanics, the shooting feels great. Drawing your bow felt much better than a game like Holopoint, because you don't have to reach back as far to grab your arrow. Outside of shooting, you have access to your spell menu when you draw your bow and point your thumb-stick in the direction of the spell you wish to select.

[b] Game Aspects [/b]

You level up as you play, and unlock spell abilities as you progress. The abilities are pretty neat, and they work well. But I personally wish they felt more epic, because most of them have weak animations and felt a bit lackluster due to this.
In the map, there are blue zones which you can shoot to teleport you to that location, to get a different perspective when shooting. As you kill enemies, some will drop gold, which you can use to purchase cosmetic items. The only chocies are helmets and bows. There are a few enemy types, and some enemies will throw axes at you. You can dodge the axe by moving physically, or you can use an ice barrier ability to bring up a dome, to shield you from incoming axes.

Outside of the tower defense game mode, there's also PVP. PVP is ok... The biggest flaw I saw in PVP is that you can see your opponents names above their heads, which makes them easy to spot and shoot. PVP doesn't add anything new or interesting, but it's nice to have, I guess..

[b] The Bad Stuff [/b]

Okay, so some of the flaws I found in Elven Assassin is that you get barely any gold when killing enemies. I understand they want to keep you coming back to play the game longer, but I've become bored with the game long before I was able to unlock any appealing cosmetic items.

Speaking of boredom, the waves of enemies progress very, very slowly, and things don't get difficult until wave 30 when you play with others. By the time wave 30 hits, you've already been playing for 30-45 minutes and are exhausted from shooting. This game desperately needs to speed things up. Most people only play 30 minutes to an hour, and when the first 30 minutes of Elven Assassin is so boring, it doesn't make me want to play it at all.
There are many ways to fix this, and the simplist solution that I can think of without changing too much, is to add an option to start the game at later waves, so you can skip the boring stuff.

I also think more robust spell abilities would help the game drastically. What is limiting the developers from creating massive fireballs raining down from the sky, or giant tornadoes sweeping the enemies away... This is a video game, and in VR there are so many amazing possibilities in a fantasy game such as Elven Assassin... but instead, we are left with boring animations and spells which look and feel weak.

Even if they added something as simple as exploding barrels you can shoot at strategic points would be a nice addition. A free game like The Lab offers these aspects, but for some reason, things like this were left out in Elven Assassin.

Gaming is about having fun, and VR is about being in awe... and unfortunately, Elven Assassin doesn't bring either of these to the table.

[b] Is It Worth It? [/b]

Elven Assassin is an older VR title, and it shows. This doesn't mean it's bad, but the devs could have done a lot more over the years to keep the game interesting and more engaging.

Overall, Elven Assassin just needs more.. More enemy types, more cosmetic items, more spells and abilities, more game types, and more things to keep me interested in playing. Once you've played for 30 minutes to an hour, you've experienced everything there is to do, which isn't much.

I'm glad they recently introduced a new map and a PvP game mode, but it's too little too late. This is definitely a game I'd recommend you pick up on sale, because there just wasn't enough to keep me interested for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000178872', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 955, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 344, 'last_played': 1625783717}
review:
Refers to single player only:

Pro:
- good working bow mechanics
- arcade like tower defense
- addictive grind for upgrades
- nice looking environments

Con:
- hard to differentiate the axe throwing orcs from the normies
- overall too long grind for upgrades, very slow progress in single player
- equipment description indicates no better values for attack/defense but is very expensive
- not all maps available in single player mode
- needs better feedback when specials are charged, meters are hardly recognizable, maybe special sounds/ voice output "fire arrow ready"
- dragons and giants have no noticeable hit feedback, e. g. get angry
- quite boring standard animations for enemies

author: {'steamid': '76561198040383749', 'num_games_owned': 371, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1615125140}
review:
Почитал отзывы, люди очень хвалили игру. В целом люблю луки в ВР играх по этому купил)  
На деле же поиграл 10 минут, и вообще не понял в чем фишка игры.
Графика очень средненькая. Как и все остальное.
Что более важно, анимации движения и смерти тоже не очень, видно на видео кстати . Орки умирают при попадании в любую часть тела и никак не реагируют на это (при попадании в голову дают голду). Нет какого либо регдола тела. 
У огра, в которого нужно попасть несколько раз, стремная некрасивая красная полоска над головой.  

Телепорт - выстрелом в место, почему нельзя было на кнопку сделать?

Хотелось бы что бы в игре про лучника, орки реагировал на стрелы в ноги, руки, грудь. Анимацией и звуками. Так же стрелы с разными эффектами, например пробития брони, поджога. 

Возможно я слишком мало поиграл и чего то не понял. Но в том же In Death гараздо приятнее графика и в целом интереснее играть)
developer_response:
Hi! 
We're sorry to hear that you didn't quite like Elven Assassin. 

I want to mention that the multiplayer mode is worth trying out. It's what our players really fell in love with. It offers many different maps which are not available in single-player mode. 
It also offers a PvP deathmatch mode, which is a bit more dynamic than the classic game. 

Also, I want to assure you that we are still working on the game and we try to make it better and more interesting with every update. 

We hope you will give Elven Assassin a second chance. 

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198039539782', 'num_games_owned': 356, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 1902, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1241, 'last_played': 1680934152}
review:
Alright before I even get started... if this weren't a VR game I'd give it a "do not recommend" but since it's in the landscape of VR titles, the bar for quality is much lower. But read the rest before making a decision.

Playing this with a friend, partner, or any other group is fun. The gameplay is simple and the progression is exciting earlier on. Getting kills feels pretty satisfying. Wave mode is unfortunately the only co-op gamemode so don't expect any sort of long-term content, but that's ok in my opinion (for a VR game).

Now let's talk about the rest...

The graphics are a bit of a let down. You'll notice in the screenshots that there is "light bloom", "depth of field", and "radial blur" used. None of these shaders are in the game. The ingame graphics are as close to default Unity as you can get. I don't know if this is necessarily false advertising but it is a disappointment to not see these sorts of shaders as at least optional ingame features. The actual 3D models you see seem like they were all bought off the asset store or done by someone who's perhaps a bit inexperienced with 3D art. It's not *bad* but it's not *good*. Compared to other VR games, well at least they AREN'T floating rectangles. There are parts of the visuals that feel almost insulting. You might notice the orcs look like they've all come from a twin factory and sprayed with different colors (red, green, and pale green). On the winter level it looks like the orcs have been sprayed with white paint.

The music is more or less non-existent. The music you can hear is uninspired and sounds generic. Not *bad* but again, not *good*.

The sound effects aren't bad actually! You may be surprised to see that they polished the sound effects quite a bit. Arrows hitting water make an actual water sound. Hitting wood makes a different sound. You can shoot a bell in the "human town". It feels like they put a lot of attention on sound effects in this game. Drawing the bow back further increases the pitch of the arrow release sound to make it feel a bit more polished. It's nice to see some attention to detail sprinkled in.

Finally let's talk about gameplay. I want to open up with a clear understanding that this was made by someone/someones who maybe lacks some game design experience. An example of this is that you can shoot lamps and they fall in one level, but in another level they remain static when shot. Just a lot of these strange inconsistencies throughout. Bowls/Pots are placed around that explode when shot on one level but then the next level is absolutely barren. The core of it is "wave starts", you "shoot orcs", sometimes there are moments where you "shoot big enemies", and you just do this until you run out of health which is deducted when enemies enter whatever you're defending. It seems like the developers caught onto the fact that this alone would be very boring so luckily we've been blessed with a RPG-ish skill system. You get 4 skills (pick from 10 of them) which you can put up to 10 points into each. Upgrading skills reduces cooldown and about half the abilities are totally useless. On top of all this you get gold for killing enemies which you can spend to buy new gear! But wait...

The progress isn't what you would expect. 10,000 gold for an armor set? I wonder what it does? More damage? Maybe my bow shoots straight over a longer distance? I mean it took me 15 hours of gameplay, surely I am to be rewarded. None of it. It's purely cosmetic. This means the only progression you get is the skill system. Level 100 and forward, you've already finished the game. There is no motivation for you as a player to continue playing besides achievements (I ran into a level 300+ player who password spammed his way into my lobby and I asked him why he still played, he said achievements).

Lastly let's talk about updates to this very long-winded early access game. I bought this game in early 2020 and didn't see an update for an entire year. Not a big deal of course but if you are hoping to get lost in what "appears" to be a really rich gaming experience, this is not that and won't ever be as long as the games core progression remains the same. The updates addressed some QoL issues and added 2 maps that are intended (or really are only fun/playable) for parties of 4.

So should you buy this?
If you want another fun VR game for you and friends, then yes absolutely. If you are hoping to get lost in a deep diving game experience, no. There are very few VR games that have actual depth and this is no exception.

I've forgot to mention that the one thing this game really does have going for it... Relative to all the other archery games on Steam? This one is certainly the best.
developer_response:
Hi. 

We realize that it has been a long time since we had a major update to our game. However, we want to assure you that we have not abandoned our game and we are still working hard on new updates. One of them is almost ready and should be released in the next few days/weeks. 

I know it's not much of a consolation since you're already waiting a long time, but I assure you there's plenty to look forward to. I hope that when the update is released, you will come back to our game and change your mind about it. 

Best regards,
Kamil Hasa,
Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561197992725747', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 349, 'last_played': 1688418173}
review:
Will It VR?: Yes, much to Gimli's chagrin.

There are some game genres that have really shown themselves to be natural fits for VR, and archery is one of them. Elven Assassin gets it right.

This isn't a fancy game. It's independently produced, and there aren't a lot of bells and whistles. There are a handful of stages and two ways to play - Arcade, which is just regular archery; and RPG, which adds some tactical spells to the mix. The hub can be a bit irritating, especially if your space is small. These are nit-picks, though, and should not keep you from trying Elven Archer.

This is a tower defense experience where you are the tower. You can teleport between set points on the map for better views, but you don't move freely. Orcs come in waves. You shoot them. Sometimes they throw axes back at you and you have to duck. Sometimes there's an ogre. Sometimes there are flying drakes. Sometimes there is a huge dragon and if you're not paying attention he will mess you up.

Elven Archer shines in multiplayer, where you can team up to cover all your angles. My wife and I have spent a lot of time in there, and we come back to it often.

Summary:
Graphics: 3/5
Immersion: 4/5
Fun: 4/5
Comfort: 5/5
Fitness: 2/5
Best wave reached in Arcade: 21

author: {'steamid': '76561199117438371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25521, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 201, 'playtime_at_review': 1558, 'last_played': 1712413265}

author: {'steamid': '76561198037528066', 'num_games_owned': 654, 'num_reviews': 105, 'playtime_forever': 7, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1609385056}
review:
[h1]Quick Review[/h1]
It didn't take me long to refund this game. It felt very bland and outdated with quality comparable to a free Engine demo/showcase. Looks so alpha-like you would think everything is just a placeholder (models, animations, effects, text) but they're not. The level of quality and polish I was given is not something I would expect in a game already four years in Early Access.

Animations are very monotonous. Only one death/hit animation for monsters as far as I noticed, and little variety in everything (models, animations, sounds, effects). The first few rounds were enough for me and I felt repetitiveness from the get go, which is a bad sign. The game didn't offer anything to counteract the repetitiveness like other seemingly repetitive games, commonly seen in tower defenses, rogue-likes, and dungeon crawlers.

Finally, the bow mechanics isn't really intuitive, you don't get the feeling that you're an elven archer. Something feels off that I can't quite pinpoint. Kills aren't satisfying and hits have no weight to them.

One thing's for sure, Even Valve's The Lab's tower defense mini-game (a free game nonetheless), and NVIDIA Funhouse's archer mini-game (a free game too) both felt better to play.
developer_response:
Hi! 
Thank you for the time you took to write your review. 
We are sorry that you did not like Elven Assassin. 

The game may seem repetitive at first sight, but this is not entirely true. There are various spells to unlock, skins to buy with in game gold and multiplayer with Coop PvE and more dynamic PvP modes. With the successive waves, the game becomes quite a challenge. 

As far as archery is concerned, it is possible to switch on "Arrow hand offset" which changes the way the bow behaves in the player's hand. Besides that, we are going to add even more maps, new mechanics, and interesting enemies to the game.

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198373332890', 'num_games_owned': 1380, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1609330006}
review:
[h1]Edit 1[/h1]
[b]Not recommended[/b]
Since the developers responded to my review I tried the game once more but my opinion has not changed. While I'm happy to hear the game is still being worked on, I would say the direction should be towards polishing what is already there instead of adding new maps and enemies.

[h3]The good[/h3]
[list]
[*]It's a tower defense with archery after all and the shooting mechanics have been done nicely enough. But that's all there is to it really.
[/list]

[h3]The bad[/h3]
[list]
[*]From the get-go, there is no option to move freely in the menu room. You have to manually rotate and point the trigger to predetermined locations to get there. [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2341801978]Screenshot[/url]
[*]There is some little interaction with the objects implemented but the fingers do not move. I have vive wands and usually the trigger moves the index finger and the grip moves the rest. But here the hand just snaps to the objects directly. Even then, the hand animations glitch into each other and sometimes I could see my wand model with the hand, and sometimes both open and close hand at the same time. This is the polish that is still needed for this game. [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2341802085]Screenshot[/url]
[*]The game has 3 maps. [url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2341801863]This[/url] is a screenshot of the first map. First thing that bothered me was that the waterfall did not have a high fps animation which kinda stands out. Nothing changes in the maps. At least some daytime, weather changes could add more variation. Imagine if the game had the option to change lighting based on time of the day. That would have been cool.
[*] The enemy types use very similar models with some added assets. A limit bit of color variation would be welcome. The running animation does not quite match the walking speed. It's stiff and unnatural.
[*] I felt like the waves for single player are actually designed to be played with multiple people. Before reaching wave 10 there was already running, flying enemies with a big one at the same time which was very difficult to handle for one player. So separate wave scaling for single player and multiplayer would make solo playing feel much better.
[*] While the archery mechanics are good enough, there is still room to improve. There could be the option to actually get each arrow out of a holster. Atm, for the big enemies you can just spam shots mindlessly. If the arrows did not regenerate in the hands, trying to get critical on their head would have beeen much more pleasant.
[*]I got 14 coins for clearing up to wave 9. The cheapest bow upgrade costs 200 and the most expensive one is 10'000 ([url=https://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=2341801661]Screenshot[/url]). So do I have to play 700 rounds to unlock the best bow and helmet?! The grinds seems to have been miscalculated. Besides, the expensive upgrades are just recolorings of the same model which is just lazy.
[*] Honorary mention to the same font that is used in menus, announcements, kills, etc. without any kind of background and framing which feels like a placeholder.
[/list]

[h3]Verdict[/h3]
I could go on how cool ideas could make this a really fun tower defense game, but for a game that has been in early access for 4 years with little improvement I do not have much hope.
For the buyers, I would recommend looking elsewhere for a more polished and modern VR game unless they really wanna try that archery tower defense game with friends.
For the developer, I suggest rethinking what they could do with this game and spending more time on polishing what they have.

P.S. I managed to run the game without problems so thumbs up for that 👍

[h1]Original[/h1]
[b]Not recommended[/b]
Clunky, old, out-dated. Needs a lot more polish to be a viable tower defense option.
At the moment it just crashes for me.
developer_response:
Hi! 
We are sorry that you did not like Elven Assassin.

I would like to assure you that the game is still being developed by our team. With the next updates we are going to add new maps and then new mechanics and interesting enemies. 

Besides, we recommend trying out the multiplayer mode. It offers Coop mode and a more dynamic PvP deathmatch.

As for game crashes, please contact us at support@wenklystudio.com. 
Send us your computer specification and version of your graphics card drivers. You can also describe exactly how the crash you are writing about looks. We would like to know at what point the game is crashing. Whether you are loading into the menu or maybe in the middle of the game. 
The more details you give us, the more efficiently we can solve the problem.

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561197970707959', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 62, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1607872590}
review:
The graphics: As great as it looks on screenshots, as ugly it gets when you see it in VR. There are no settings, nothing to tweak or adjust - it just looks blurry and ugly.

Sound: Let's not talk about it. 

Controls: You can pull back the string, aim and then release the string. Maybe you hit, maybe you don't. Maybe your bow get stuck in mid-air. Maybe you miss target and teleport to another location. If you want to turn around, you literally have to TURN AROUND (and also remember not to turn further, because you eventually trip over the cables) - there is no way to turn by controller.

Gameplay: Repetitive. Aim and shoot, aim and shoot. Do some spells (if they work), then aim and shoot. Use a cannon or a catapult, then aim and shoot again. 

Bugs: Pleny of them. You hit w/o dealing damage. Invisible enemies. Getting stuck in mid-air while teleporting, then die. Get hit by invisible axe. Glitch through surfaces. This game seems to be one mayor bug.


Conclusion: Steam tells me, this game is "released" since 10/16, which I translate to "in development for over 4 years". It costs 15€ and delivers very little content but many bugs instead. Got a refund.
developer_response:
Hi! 

Thank you for your opinion. 
We are sorry that you did not like Elven Assassin. 

As for the bow, you might like the "Arrow hand offset" option. 
Thanks to it, the bow behaves a little differently. 

We also highly recommend trying out the multiplayer mode. 
It offers a coop and PvP deathmatch mode. 
Thanks to these modes the game gains more depth and gives a lot of fun. 

Also, I want to assure you that our game is constantly being developed and updated. We plan to expand the game with new content such as new maps and enemies. 

I would also like to ask you about the bugs you mentioned. 
Could you describe them more precisely? 
We would like to know how they looked and when they occurred. 
We have never heard about similar bugs and we would like to know more about them. We would be very grateful for your answer.

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561197970627863', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 297, 'last_played': 1631460803}
review:
Edit:
Now, after switching to the "knuckels support" version and back to the "normal" version, my Index controllers are working fine. (Tipp for everyone who have the same problem)

I can't recommend it because the index controllers are not supported. If you start the game, both hands stick to the ground and no motion is detected.Absolutely useless with the index. For your information, I played my 5 hours of with my old Vive.
developer_response:
Hi! 
We are sorry that you have encountered such a problem.
 
Our game supports index controllers, so apparently, there must have occurred a bug. 

Please contact us at support@wenklystudio.com to clarify the issue. Please also send me the Player.log file. You can get it by following these steps:

1. Try to reproduce this problem.
2. Close the application
3. Go to C:\Users\%username%\AppData\LocalLow\WenklyStudio\Elven Assassin
4. Copy the Player.log file and send it to us as an attachment.

It will allow us to verify what the problem is and find a solution.

review:
This could be a very fun game. I'm not sure of the status of development, being in early access since 2016 leads me to believe it's probably dead. 

This game worked once, and now it just loads and freezes immediately.
developer_response:
Hi! 

We are sorry that you are experiencing such problems with the game. 

Could you describe your problem in more detail? Is this what happens when the game is loaded? In the menu? While loading on the map? 

Besides, we recommend you to update your graphics card drivers. Outdated drivers can cause errors while the game is loading. 

In order to find out more about your problem, you can send us an email at support@wenklystudio.com.

Player.log file will also be very important.
Please follow the steps below, and it will definitely make it easier for us to find the cause.

1. Try to reproduce this error.
2. Close the application
3. Go to C:\Users\%username%\AppData\LocalLow\WenklyStudio\Elven Assassin
4. Copy the Player.log file and send it to us as an attachment.

With all this information we will be able to search for the cause.
We look forward to the response from you.

When it comes to Early Access, I want to assure you that people are playing Elven Assassin and we are constantly working on new updates.

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198026348176', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 217, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 51, 'last_played': 1671739139}
review:
[strike]Im Grunde ein Gutes Spiel. Es unterstützt nur leider keine Valve Index. Man kann die Spells nicht nutzen, weil die Keybindings nicht ordentlich gemappt sind. 

@Devs: If you fix the Problem with the Valve Index Keybindings i will buy it again. There are no possibilities to use the the spells over the trackpad.[/strike]

[hr][/hr]

Meine erste Rezension war mit einer negativen Bewertung versehen, da ich nicht gerafft habe, wie man die Spells benutzt. Manchmal hat man einfach ein Brett vorm Kopf. Nachdem sich dann ein Entwickler gemeldet hatte um mir zu sagen das es doch geht, musste ich es nochmal ausprobieren. Bin also ins Spiel rein, ne singleplayer Runde gestartet und hab's wieder nicht gerafft. Am Stick gedrückt, gedreht und in alle Richtungen gezerrt. Nichts. Also, nochmal gegooglet(schreibt man das so?) aber nichts gefunden. Naja, schreib ich ne Email, hab ich mir gedacht. Gedacht, getan. Danach wurde ich aber etwas ungeduldig und hab's Spiel nochmal angemacht. Hab mir die Spells-Seite nochmal angeguckt und siehe da, da steht auch irgendwo beschrieben wie man die Spells benutzen kann. Hab dann nochmal ein singleplayer Spiel gestartet und es funktionierte. 

Und was lernen wir daraus? Manchmal sieht man vor lauter Brettern die Bäume nicht mehr.

Zum Spiel selbst will ich gar nicht viel sagen. Es macht einfach riesen Bock und ist sehr gut gemacht. Es fühlt sich fast wie ein echter Bogen an.
developer_response:
Hi! 

Thank you for your feedback. 

When it comes to controlling Elven Assassin with Valve Index, spells are assigned to the stick of the left controller. If you want to use spells with a trackpad, you can try to assign keys on SteamVR. Unfortunately, this is currently the only solution I can suggest.

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198042113113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1703709977}
review:
I was gifted this game to play with my brother but unfortunately they don't support cross-platform play between Steam VR and Quest users. 

So that starts off the review well eh? 

The bad
1- No cross platform
2- Another wave shooter
3- Impossible to get far solo
4- The feel of the aiming/shooting mechanics feels very unsatisfying. "Quest and Index". I prefer Valve's longbow game and even Rec Room feels better. 

The good. 
I can't think of much considering the cost of this very basic wave shooter.
I guess the visuals and audio are good. 
I received this game as a gift and requested a refund so that tells you plenty..
developer_response:
Hi! 
Thank you for that opinion. 
We are sorry that you are not happy with Elven Assassin. 

Cross-platform between PC and Oculus Quest is not yet supported due to the hardware limitations of Oculus Quest. We are working on a solution to this problem, but I can't say when we will be able to solve it. Elven Assassin supports crossplay between Oculus Rift S and Steam for the time being. 

As for the variety of gameplay, Elven Assassin also offers PvP deathmatch mode which is much more dynamic than classic wave shooter. We recommend trying it because it is a completely different kind of gameplay. 

As far as the difficulty of the game is concerned, you can unlock better and better spells with the level up, which definitely makes the game easier to play. 

As for the handling of the bow, the "arrow hand offset" changes the way the bow behaves. Changing this setting often helps players in the gameplay. 

We hope you will give Elven Assassin a second chance and change your mind about it. 

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198172675590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 72239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 804, 'last_played': 1707407443}
review:
I received this game from a friend as a gift.  I had been eyeing it for a while, but had kind of put it towards the bottom of my "to get" list.  I wish I had bought this sooner.  I am having such fun with this game that I can actually lose myself and suddenly six or seven hours have gone by...

The things I like about this game:

1.) The graphics and models are really great
2.) The levels are very cool and very detailed.
3.) The bow mechanics are really well done.
4.) Co-op multiplayer is a lot of fun if you can find an unlocked game (more on that later).
(EDIT): 5.) This is fantastic exercise.  I have actually started playing this with weights on my wrists.  

My complaints or things that I wish would improve (hopefully some of these will be addressed as development continues):

1.) I wish there were more playable levels other than the 3-4 that are already there.
2.) The equipment upgrades are neat, but pointless other than for cosmetics.  It would be nice if the equipment and bow upgrades actually did something to improve your character in some way --- let you take an extra axe before you die, decrease spell recharge time, increase arrow damage, give you additional skills, etc.  
3.) Leveling doesn't seem to do much other than give you an additional spell point and specify to other players how long you have been playing the game (I played a co-op with someone who was level 204 the other day).  
4.) As already mentioned, co-op is a blast provided you can find a game to play in.  Most people lock their games and I understand the reason for allowing people to lock games, so this may just be more of a complaint about the general anti-socialness of the community playing this game.  But, it's really annoying when all you see on co-op is a bunch of locked game when they all have room for 1-2 more people to join.  If you can find an open game, though, all the people playing are really fantastic, really nice, and this game is a great way to meet people.  
5.) When a multiplayer game ends, it takes FOREVER for the game to give you the option to restart the game, so if you do find a good group of people to play with, you immediately lose them at the end of the game as they go in search of other open games because it is faster to quit and rejoin multiplayer than it is to wait for someone to restart the game.  Be nice if this could be sped up A LOT.
6.) I have a problem getting my mic to work with this game.  I could easily see this one being on me and my computer, but I will mention it here since I am complaining. (EDIT): This was a HMD issue unrelated to the game that was fixed.
7.)  I wish there was an option to rotate the camera.  As I move to different towers, some of the towers are oriented such that they make me face in directions that are not as well covered by my VR sensors.  Did my best to re-setup my environment to fix this issue, but sometimes there is only so much you can do.  This would not have been an issue if there was an option to rotate the camera in the game.    
(EDIT): 8.) The devs on this game are terrible.  They are more interested in putting new features in the newer Quest version of this game than they are in actually finishing this game which has been around WAY longer.  That says these guys are more interested in a quick buck than doing a good job on what would be a solid game.  Game is great, devs not so much.  
(EDIT): 9). There is an un-godly long wait between waves, especially at the higher ones.  This has been an issue for months now (since the last "recent" update) with zero response or fixes from the devs.  Expect to be standing around for a bit once you get good at this game.  

Overall, great game!  Very fun, and very good exercise.  I would like to see some of the issues I mentioned be addressed/improved, but despite my complaints I think this game is solid and worth getting, even at full price. (Edit): Just expect to be constantly angered and disappointed by bad development practices from incompetent developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198161494300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1597860179}
review: Graphics look cool, but Crossplatform dosent work yet or updates are behind im on version d my girl on oculus is on version f so just another game to refund once more again.... i cannot see her multiplayer game and she cant see mine
developer_response:
Hi!

We are sorry to hear that you are not completely satisfied with Elven Assassin.

For now, cross-play only works between Steam and the Oculus Rift version. Oculus Quest has a separate version of Elven Assassin due to its hardware limitations. We plan to enable cross-play between all platforms in the future, but we can't say when this will happen. 

If you want to play together right now, the person who uses the Oculus Quest must connect it via Oculus Link to his/her computer and buy Elven Assassin on Steam or Oculus Rift. 

In addition, on future Sunday at 9 AM PST, there will be PvP deathmatch training tournaments with cross-play enabled, so maybe then you will try to play together. The actual tournament with $1000 prize pool will take place on September 12th and 13th. 

If you want to know more, please visit: https://www.vrfitsummit.com/tournaments/elven-assassin.

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198041222968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 572, 'last_played': 1676413064}
review:
What a great game, seriously. It fun to play with a full team of four. On my valve index this game is a blast. I've found after 60 rounds i'm breaking a sweat. Valve should partner with these guys directly because they got the right idea for an addictive VR game! The possibilities of "what could be" are quite endless. 

A few notes:
Magic: Makes a world of difference. A cool idea would be to have poison or bio magic. Something like a standard poison arrow, a AOE poison, a slow arrow, multi-poison arrow, etc. 

Equipment: Equipment with actually elements embedded into them would be neat. For instance, the Ice set gives ice elements. 

A quick start at a higher level once you achieve past a certain rank/level would be cool addition.

A lot of fun and I'm excited to see what maps they create and new enemies: maybe little goblins that run extremely fast or enemies that heal other enemies. I feel this is the closest thing to a 4-player tower defense game!

Great job devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045381616', 'num_games_owned': 667, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 187, 'last_played': 1667504716}
review: Не то чтобы игра прямо плоха - стрельба сделана неплохо и в принципе за пострелять несколько часов - не так уж и дорого. С другой стороны, процесс крайне монотонный, враги однообразные, прокачка практически огтсутствует - есть заклинания для стрел. Бедность контента разработчик пытается компенсировать сложностью прогресса - чтобы что-то купить нужно ГРИНДИТЬ часами. Как дополнительнный фитнес-тренажер, если у вас уже куплены остальные популярные игры в стиме - сойдет, но и только. Весь фитнес будет кстати заключаться в том, чтобы изредка приседать при броске в вас топора. В целом - не рекомендую.
developer_response:
Hi!

Thank you for your comment. 
We are sorry to hear that you are not quite happy with our game. 

We plan to add more interesting content to the game in the future like new maps and mechanics. You should also try multiplayer mode if you haven't done so. It allows you to play co-op or deathmatch.

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198018673563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 58, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1588992553}
review: For a hardcore gamer like myself, this game is kind of bland. HOWEVER I'm not the one that enjoys this game - my mom is. She is not a gamer at all, and often has trouble even making a character move around in a 3D space. She loves the crap out of this game because it's simple to understand and play. It's a great entry-level VR game for people who don't consider themselves gamers. But if you are someone like me who plays high-octane and complex games - you'll find it pretty boring after a few minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128785110', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 985, 'last_played': 1705195805}

author: {'steamid': '76561198106311985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 3778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 781, 'last_played': 1691859125}
review: Quite a nice game, and really gives you good exercise, but it's a bit glitchy when it comes to saving your progress. I've had to purchase the same bow upgrades so many times now - sometimes it remembers what you've bought, and sometimes it doesn't, but your money is gone and then you have to save up to buy the same frikkin' thing again. Still good fun though if you don't take it too seriously.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019035889', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1589830764}
review:
Didn't like it. For whatever reason the screen turns red in the middle of the game and you can not play any more. So overall totally boring.

The physics feel pretty good in fact except the aiming which is a little inprecise.

But the graphics are nice. Maybe I cheat it to enjoy the graphics without bothering about the interruptive game play.
developer_response:
Hi!

Thank you for your feedback. 
Sorry to hear you had an unpleasant experience with our game. 

The problem you described looks like you were killed by an orc axe or a dragon. It seems like you were playing multiplayer mode where you have to wait until the next wave or until the player uses a revive spell on you after you die. In order not to die from the axe you have to dodge it or block it with the Ice Shield spell. If you were so kind as to describe exactly what it looked like, we would appreciate it. 

Also, you've mentioned some difficulties with the bow aiming - have you tried the "Arrow offset" option from in-game settings? Moreover, since then the game has got some changes and we plan to add a lot of new content in the future so maybe you should give a try to our game once again! 

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561199004431327', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 926, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 830, 'last_played': 1668328009}
review:
https://youtu.be/GND8vEH3d8c
Хотите почувствовать себя лесным эльфом? Кстати вы знали, что средняя продолжительность жизни лесных эльфов 700 лет. А самые старшие из них доживают до 1200 лет. Так вот, в этой реальности вы будете, например, девятьсот летним эльфом! И будете защищать свой замок и свой народ от нашествия орков и летающих драконов! А если тебе сложно справиться одному, то ты можешь собрать совет лесных эльфов и выбрать себе соратников для борьбы с превосходящим вас противником! В общем играй один или с друзьями! А весь смысл игры — это отбить волну наступающего на вас противника стреляя из лука. На первой волне сложности вы не почувствуете, а проходя всё дальше и дальше, вы столкнётесь с полчищами орков, и некоторые из них будут бросать в вас оружие, от которых вам нужно будет уворачиваться. Так же вы столкнетесь с гигантскими боссами, которые могут вас убить, и вам придется перемещаться от одного укрытия к другому! Так что, скучать вам точно не придется! Игра очень лёгкая в управлении, поэтому даже ребёнок с 7 лет может спокойно разобраться и встать с вами плечом к плечу в борьбе против агрессора! Во время игры вы можете зарабатывать деньги, которые вы можете потратить на новый набор доспехов или оружие. И опыт, который вы можете потратить на различного рада магического улучшения, например замораживающая, огненная стрела или взрывающая стрела!
А если вы истребите всех орков, то сможете устрить турнир против друг друга!
Сюжета в игре нет, здесь вы будете просто получать море удовольствия от геймплея! Графика и звуковое сопровождение радуют глаз и слух! Поэтому я обязательно вам советую почувствовать себя защитником замка! И спасти свой народ!

author: {'steamid': '76561198096097755', 'num_games_owned': 363, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 273, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 265, 'last_played': 1585383128}
review: Прекрасная игра для VR, полчаса-час в день можно потратить и получить хорошие впечатления. Мало где нормально реализована стрельба из лука в VR. Ну разве что в Стим Лабс ещё круто было, но там это больше мини-игра. Так же есть стимул играть дальше, чтобы открывать всё новые скилы, которые заметно облегчат прохождение (например, огненные стрелы или даже огненный дождь на врагов) и скины оружия и шлема, который видят только другие игроки. Однозначно рекомендую всем, у кого есть шлем. На Windows Mixed Reality работает хорошо, правда один из режимов прицеливания в настройках полностью мешает целиться, скорее всего, из-за того, что игра изначально шла под другую форму контроллеров, от рифта или вайва, но и основной режим прицеливания тоже очень хорош.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079457457', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 25445, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8739, 'last_played': 1613785047}
review:
I really like the opportunity to work as a team and talk with others. It makes the game fun. It is also fun to watch your progress. Leveling up can be addictive. My most un-favorite thing about the game are the players who come in to ruin your game or bully you out of your space. I wish there was a way to be able to eject them from the game.
 I hear rumors that there are upgrades coming to this game which will be great. Looking forward to them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029848552', 'num_games_owned': 673, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 63, 'last_played': 1569638120}
review:
[h1]Played on: HTC Vive[/h1]

Wave-based, bow-shooter combat. Stop the orcs, trolls, and more from breaching the walls and stealing your women! It's a tower defense style game, where you're a tower!

[h1]Pros:[/h1][list]
[*]Loads of fun as a bow-and-arrow fanatic
[*]Multiplayer
[*]Unlockables to increase power and style
[*]Great arm workout![/list]

[h1]Cons:[/h1][list]
[*]Can really hurt if your arms aren't used to it
[*]Can get repetitive after you play a bit

[h1]Verdict:[/h1]
[code]8/10 - Out of all the bow and arrow games, I think this one takes the cake for me. I enjoyed the wave-based combat with a friend and always trying to top our last record.
[/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198156470387', 'num_games_owned': 263, 'num_reviews': 63, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1577987988}
review:
I feel like i'm not getting something with this game. It's got some good bow shooting mechanics but that's about it.
The enemy that stuns you is really annoying because you can't dodge it and it basically dooms you when you get hit. It's also not extraordinarily obvious who this enemy is going to be. 

I'd like to like it but I don't. It has been a mostly frustrating and at the same time boring experience. I do think it has potential. The base mechanics are good. Teleporting where you shoot is a good idea. Maybe when the game is updated or when I play it again I try again. But until then its a no for me. 

I've not played the multiplayer so maybe i'm missing something there.

Edit: I originally gave this a negative rating but i've recieved a great response from the developers which I want to reward in some way. So i'm just turning it positive until I play it again and say more about it.
developer_response:
Hi!

Thank you for that comment.
Sorry to hear you didn't quite like our game. 

To avoid being stunned you have to squat, lean to the side, or block it with an Ice Shield spell by using it on the floor. It creates a protective ice shield that destroys any axe that comes in contact.

If you feel bored playing the single player mode, you should try the multiplayer which offers co-op and PvP deathmatch. Besides, in the future, we are going to add more content such as catapults and new maps. 

If you want to know more, check out Elven Assassin on Facebook or Discord!

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio
