author: {'steamid': '76561198154266604', 'num_games_owned': 300, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 2031, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 440, 'last_played': 1593964159}
review:
Fun game.  Essentially, you are not really an assassin so much as a defender as you grab your bow and fight off orcs, giants, dragons, or worse.  It's pretty much a wave based shooter with a bow and can be quite fun.  I like this game compared to others of the type in that the bad guys actually throw stuff at you and bite back while many of the other bow defender games don't have that trait.  

Here are a couple videos for those with an interest:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9F2qRBNTzAE

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=HyB8gy8y6M8

author: {'steamid': '76561198209497567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 106, 'last_played': 1680454569}
review: Can't say enough good about this. It's one of my favorite games, and a great archery game. Now it has multiplayer as well. Mostly you stay in a courtyard and shoot arcs as they arrive at the castle, so it isn't complicated. You can teleport from tower to tower, to get a better shot. Each wave is harder. Well done!

author: {'steamid': '76561198054631946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 6627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2837, 'last_played': 1707174602}
review: que dire..c est super...que du kiff...ah si seulment on pouvait prendre les haches et leur rebalancer. ou les arreter en leur tirant dessus..apres tout  on est des elfes. ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561198137633544', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 7094, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 256, 'last_played': 1693176543}
review:
This to me is easily the best VR archery game hands down.  Great shooting mechanics. simplistic content but still fun none the less. 

Definetely a game that shine's in multi player rather than single player, which leads me to my only drawback to the game. there are 2 versions, the steam beta(updated) and the oculus more vanilla original version. These 2 communities can't play with one another. The overall community itself isn't large to begin with, but yet its split. i've look everyday but have yet to see a multi player game going on in the steam version. i've started some games and nothing. Ghost town.  On oculus there are a small but dedicated crew that gets on just about daily so i can always find games goin on. I fear that this version is goin to suffer until they update the oculus version and combine the communities. 

I really do love the game itself and play a few hours almost daily. i just hope they get it all together sooner rather than later

author: {'steamid': '76561197966771640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1606956058}
review: Very limited in scope right now (just one stage with increasing waves), but the overall look, interface, and models all appear polished and gameplay is fun. Upgrade system to kit gives some replayability as well. A word of warning though, I'm a Rift user and generally wouldn't recommend this game unless you have a third sensor, because you need 365 degrees of movement to fully enjoy it. You can play in a smaller space, but it may be frustrating without a third sensor.

author: {'steamid': '76561198332757083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 10774, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3387, 'last_played': 1614361415}
review: One of best VR games I have played. The cooperative multiplayer is the most fun part of the game. Definitely worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198015376573', 'num_games_owned': 362, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2440, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1650413452}
review: I really recommend this game. I'm fairly new to the VR world but this is one of my go-to games every time I get the Vive out. Single player is fun, multi player is fun, fun all around. There are definitely improvements to be made, but that doesn't make this a bad game in the slightest.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011324831', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 2769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 616, 'last_played': 1686236829}
review:
This is a very fun game, similar to QuiVr yet also different. The enemies are much more "realistically" drawn. If you have ever wanted to shoot orcs with an elven bow, this game lets you do this very convincingly. The bow mechanics are a little easier than in QuiVr. You don't have to reach back to grab an arrow. It just appears in your hand. Plus it has wyverns and dragons! The single player is good, and the multiplayer is better. 

In short, if you like QuiVr you will like this. If you ever wanted to defend your city from orcs or dragons, you will like this. I definitely recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039387969', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 973, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 583, 'last_played': 1649112995}

author: {'steamid': '76561198064427522', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 368, 'last_played': 1568393314}
review: I love this game, the only improvement I think that would make a huge impact would be the ability to shoot down the axes that the opponents throw at you. Otherwise this is super fun for the price!

author: {'steamid': '76561197978406355', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 6049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1221, 'last_played': 1637558070}
review:
This game does several things better than "The Lab": you have to duck, it has boss monsters, multiplayer, leveling up, and monster variety.
A year later, I've come back to it. Multiplayer turns exercise into a fun activity, and there's 4 co-op maps now, plus a pvp map. There's always a game somewhere you can join. This VR title stands the test of time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971002978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1601263125}
review: Awesome game, Great on Steam or Oculus home, I grabbed the steam VR edition as well just to try the latest BETA and support the devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561197994459679', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1525171323}
review:
Pros:
-Very nice quick bow work, good draw, aim and fire.
-Good graphics.
-Cheap.

Cons:
-Very little gameplay elements, just one tower system to sit in and shoot (one map).
-No rounds, just increasingly large waves (i.e. no real goals, just see how long you last).
-Bad guys shoot you through each other, from the other end of the map, and with perfect accuracy.
-You die in one hit.
-No idea of how to teleport, had to figure that out.
-No tutorial.
-No warning about when you are about to be dragoned to death (just sudden fire if you didn't see it coming due to watching guys behind you).

All in all, promising, but needs structure, a tutorial and more maps/goals.
developer_response:
Hi!

I came to tell you that since 2017 the game has undergone major changes. 

We have added more interesting content to the game and improved the graphics.  Moreover, the performance of the game is better and the multiplayer mode is much more fun! 
In the near future, we are going to add more maps and new enemies to the game.
 
We hope that you would like to try our game again.

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198027705696', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 358, 'last_played': 1594767153}

author: {'steamid': '76561198375005549', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 2296, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1017, 'last_played': 1622292197}
review: Тауэр дефенс с орками, драконами, с возможностью аппать стрелы и применять изученные способности - одному и в мультиплеере. Просто круто.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047460017', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 441, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1576376842}
review: This was the best 5 dollars I have spent on a VR game. When I spent the money, I didn't realize that I was buying a gym membership too, dodging flying axes while shooting arrows definably got the blood pumping. Playing on co-op is the way to go, there are just too many orcs to head shot at the higher levels. It is also very satisfying to get past 15 + waves without the town being damaged while playing with 3 other people online. I have heard that there are some lag issues when not the host, but I have only been the host so far therefore I can’t confirm if this is still an issue or if just poor internet on the other players part. I will have to say my biggest complaint is that the few hours I have spent on so far there was only a few people online playing. In the end, I would recommend this to anyone that likes the longbow game from The Lab game pack or looking for a VR game, since it is on sale I would call it a steal at $4.99.

author: {'steamid': '76561197963405228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 191, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1562209394}
review: Very neat archery game, I hope they add some of the level up features I see in the lobby.  Worth maybe $10-$15 IMO.  I wish some more people where online to play with, but still fun alone.  Come on, stop sitting on the fence, convince at least 1 friend to buy a vive so the industry will make us more games like this in AAA fasion!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047045358', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1220, 'last_played': 1571750920}
review:
Great game. Just some suggestions.

Wish for more content like quest, or daily challenges where you can earn more gold and rewards. 

More maps like the original Town, monsters and items. I feel that Large map is quite hard to play because of the current resolution of HTC Vive headset, I can hardly see monster that are far away.

Or maybe skill sets where we can choose to build, like ice skills to slow or freeze enemies. Player can either play fire or ice or even hybrid.

Imagine If we can grab the thrown axes landed on the wooden pillars and throw it back at them, that would be very cool. Or shoot the incoming axe with our arrow.

author: {'steamid': '76561198013608934', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1590857837}
review:
C'est crevant, c'est intense, c'est pas hyper beau mais c'est pas grave parce que c'est un des meilleurs jeux de tir à l'arc disponibles avec The Lab (aussi chouette mais plus simpliste) et Deadly Hunter (Ausss chouette mais au lieu d'être posté sur des tours on est au milieu de l'ennemi, donc c'est vraiment plus stressant).

Au programme: géants a hérisser de flèches, orcs lanceurs de grosses haches à esquiver, petits dragons, gros dragons, skins a débloquer, possibilité de changer de poste de tir en pleine partie, et surtout multijoueur!

Le jeu est assez difficile.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978667820', 'num_games_owned': 1100, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1711097989}
review:
Eines der Besten Pfeil und Bogen Spiele im Moment, vor allem wegen der bereits etwas fortgeschrittenen Entwicklung.

Grundlegend:
Die Bedienung von Pfeil und Bogen geht sehr gut von der Hand, das Zielen ist einfach aber realistisch. Die Pfeile müssen nicht vom Rücken gezogen werden (was ich persönlich als positiv empfinde) sondern erscheinen automatisch in der Hand. Die Flugbahn ist schnell verinnerlicht.

Es gibt zwei spielbare Karten. Bei der ersten verteidigt man ein Elfendorf. Es gibt vier Punkte an denen man stehen kann und man wechselt durch einen Schuss auf den jeweiligen Punkt den Standort. Bei der zweiten Karte unterstützt man die Menschen in der Verteidigung einer Feste (erinnert ein wenig an Helms Klamm). Hier gibt es mehr Möglichkeiten bei der Verteidigung, denn es stehen auch Katapulte und Kanonen zur Verfügung. Diese Karte ist aber (noch) nicht so ausgewogen wie die erste.

Die Gegner bestehen aus Fantasy Wesen, die sich auch mal wehren (so werfen bspw. einige Orks nach einem Treffer eine Axt nach dem Schützen vor denen man sich ducken muss).

Während der Gefechte sammelt man Gold, das man in Ausrüstung stecken kann (nur kosmetischer Natur) und steigt Level auf, für die man wiederum Magie kaufen kann um so besondere Pfeile einsetzen zu können.

Der Einzelspieler ist recht schwierig, da man nach einigen Wellen schnell die Position wechseln und dazu noch sehr schnelle Folgen von Pfeilen los lassen muss um zu bestehen. Der Multiplayer spielt sich da ein gutes Stück einfacher und funktioniert ganz hervorragend. Selbst mit Random Mitspielern hält man einige Wellen lang durch. Wirklich gut funktioniert es, wenn man sich mit den Mitspielern absprechen kann. Leider ist auf den Europäischen Servern relativ wenig los (aber es sind eigentlich immer 1-2 Spiele gerade aktiv, wo man einsteigen kann). Auch während der Wellen ist das Spiel immer motivierend, da man sich jederzeit den Punktestand der 4 Spieler im Vergleich ansehen kann.

Das wohl direkteste Konkurrenzprodukt dürfte Quivr sein, das meines Erachtens im Moment etwas das Nachsehen hat, denn Elven Assassin bietet durch die zwei Karten, die Ausrüstung und das Magiesystem bereits einen hohen Wiederspielwert.

Man benötigt im Übrigen etwas Platz, denn es ist immer mal nötig sich zu bewegen (um auszuweichen oder einen besseren Winkel zu bekommen). 1,5x2m reichen aus.

Negativ bis jetzt:
- die ersten Wellen sind bei vier Spielern sehr langweilig, weil es zu wenige Gegner von zu wenigen Spawnpoints sind. Da prügelt man sich Anfangs quasi um die Abschüsse.
- Während ein Orc eine Axt wirft, ist er unverwundbar.

Für mich ist das Spiele eine ganz klare Kaufempfehlung und eines der Besten VR Spiele im Moment, vor allem für 10€. Mich bringt es gehörig ins schwitzen und es ist gerade mit seinen kurzen Runden ein ideales VR Spiel ohne anstrengend zu werden. Und wenn jemand einen Mitspieler für den Multiplayer sucht: einfach hinzufügen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198294969782', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1502863206}
review:
Very good archery game
You have a village behind you Life Size that you must proptect from many angels to switch from.
shoot the enemies as they approach while avoiding there flying knife or weapons
you can shoot at certain location to jump/spawn for a better view to attack! like game Quaver,

author: {'steamid': '76561198002047902', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 905, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 894, 'last_played': 1518414658}
review: This is the first time I've ever written a review and I'm doing so because I love this game! To me this is tower defense at its finest and the multiplayer experience is the most fun I've had in VR! The enemies look so realistic, the combat is exciting and the new content was better than expected. Beware...your arms WILL get tired and you have to stay light on your toes to be ready to duck! Very well done and highly recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049394193', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 664, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 496, 'last_played': 1531825410}

Man könnte SO viel mehr daraus machen. Hoffe das passiert auch. Alles in allem aber sehr spaßig!

author: {'steamid': '76561198319221590', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1909, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1611079680}

author: {'steamid': '76561197971949650', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 28, 'playtime_forever': 7908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2605, 'last_played': 1559607248}
review:
I am really loving this game.  Dev, you'll see a bunch of us who regularly come together to play multiplayer.  Here are some opportunities that we are thinking would make the game even more gratifying:

1. If a level is completed without any damage, reward the fort damage an addtion 1% health.
2. If a level is completed without any damage or casulties, reward fort damage and perhaps fully recharage all spell arrows going into next wave.
3. The big dragon, when killed, needs to either fall or fry.
4. Why are the axes white after they hit us?
5. Offer multiplayers to begin at a higher wave, and grant bonus points for doing so (this scheme should be thought out).

author: {'steamid': '76561198025206104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 4081, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1537, 'last_played': 1678048445}
review:
This is one of my most played Games! the skill of shooting a bow is all there, and dodging the axe of the orc you just pissed off keeps you on your toes. they have continuesly kept the updates coming. (new maps updates, enemies, shops you can buys upgrades at based on your leveling up. its worth the money as is, but i crave so much more because ists THAT GOOD! I have strong faith they will continue to add more content as they are in early access.
  LOVE that its multi player, and anyone can join your game even after you started you "multiplayer game". And if you want to test you might alone, they have single player mode as well.

author: {'steamid': '76561198000487150', 'num_games_owned': 140, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 142, 'last_played': 1576195651}
review: I played the QuiVR demo and was instantly hooked on this genre.  I picked up this and Queendom based on reviews and I can say without a doubt that Elven Archer is the better of the bunch (and cheaper!)  The developer has recently increased the base price to $9.99 which is a steal.  Pick up this game now while it's still an amazing value.  I'm not sure it's worth $20 yet (just 2 levels), but $10 is perfect.  So much fun replayability on the same levels - try multiplayer, that's the key.  Solo play only it's probably only worth $10.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053412386', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 4527, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3574, 'last_played': 1669515129}
review:
Its a great game but the gold system isnt working correctly there is no rhyme or reason that i can figuare out for multi player split maybe someone can explain it to me or look into if its working properly. other than that slight glitch its a fun game looking forward to new content. Great job Devs.
Update : 6/12/2018  yes that was the issue but it was fixed so quickly i didnt  give it a second thought thank you.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970853264', 'num_games_owned': 236, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 172, 'last_played': 1705750176}
review:
I love this game.

It's basically the same as Quiver -
- Defend a town gate
- shoot orcs and stuff with arrows.
- multiplayer, and single player

The differences are -
- Nicer looking bad guys (none of the neon blue that annoys me so much in Quiver)
- The some of the ordinary bad guys fight back, not just the bosses.
- Bad guys follow more varied pathways to the gate.

This game progresses faster than Quiver, and for some reason I get more of a workout. And for me, thats a good thing. 

Yes its a wave shooter with no story - but its still fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158010115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 7561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1396, 'last_played': 1595461451}
review:
Si vous avez apprécié "Longbow" sous "The Lab", alors vous aimerez ce titre! Ça m'a pris quelques "rounds" pour maîtriser le tir, mais une fois réussi, ça roule bien. Faire des "head shot" devient facile, et très utile contre les Orcs :)

PLUS:
Immersif.
Se pencher pour éviter les haches!
Points de magie pour vos flèches.

CONTRE:
Bas beaucoup de serveurs multijoueur
Achat de casques, arc, mais qui ne change pas vos aptitudes
Mode solo redondant

author: {'steamid': '76561197972337172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 356, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1491987527}
review:
What I really like about this game is how pretty this game. Also, the axe dodging game mechanic is pretty cool and unique.

What I really don't like though is the way the bow works, it seems so unsatisfying compared to the lab / holopoint / quiVR. Another thing this game needs is ragdoll effects on death animations. Also something more to break up the monotony such as skills, or spells. It currently shows promise, but with those changes this game will be a winner.
developer_response:
Hi!

I came with good news! 

The game has changed a lot since your review was published. We have added new content, upgraded multiplayer mode, enhanced graphics and improved game performance. Soon we want to add even more interesting content to the game such as new maps, new enemies and interesting mechanics. 

We would appreciate it if you would give Elven Assassin a second chance!

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198263268532', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 506, 'last_played': 1593955601}

author: {'steamid': '76561197970519663', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1054, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1577676136}
review: Elven Assasin and QuiVr have the best mechanics and the best feel, by far. This is a slightly better looking game, REALLY fun, highly recommeneded!! Great work guys, love this one! A++

author: {'steamid': '76561197974348668', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 293, 'last_played': 1600254216}
review:
Sehr gutes Pfeil und Bogen Spiel.

Gegner kommt nicht nur zu Lande.

Bisher zwei Maps - wobei eine davon Katapulte und Kanonen hat, die man entsprechend nutzen kann.

Hoher Wiederspielwert ist vorhanden. Zum einen gibts Gold für das man Ausrüstung kaufen kann, zum anderen mit jedem Level Spell-Points mit denen man diverse Zaubersprüche kaufen kann. Aus der Auswahl lassen sich dann vier Zaubersprüche aufs Pad legen und damit den geladenen Pfeil zum Bleistift in einen Feuerpfeil verwandeln.

Gut für Roomscale da man ab und an um die Ecke bzw. vom Turm auf den Boden schauen muss. Ausserdem sollte man sich frei bewegen können, um ausweichen zu können - die Orcs wehren sich nämlich^^

author: {'steamid': '76561198003867406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1516503626}
review: Didn't have high expectations for this game originally but it is an awsome bow game. The level design is on point and the price for the game is more then fair. Take my word for it though, never try to play single player, this is a multiplayer game and it will be far more enjoyable with people there to help you.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026599822', 'num_games_owned': 293, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1491258422}
review: Pretty decent, progression is too slow tho. Tried multiplayer couldnt find anyone. I guess its way more fun in mulitplayer, the issue is that levels seem to be built for a multiplayer, so playing alone is very difficult mostly because of the awkward positioning of the stations you shoot from. Its ok game, but i am not sure how much better experience to the Lab demo this is and if its worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084412885', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 2232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 271, 'last_played': 1692465409}

author: {'steamid': '76561198354783842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 13591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 3678, 'last_played': 1551325816}
review: Twice today during play in the village, I was transported to the game lobby. Just got to level 41. I did have another player also in the 40's level tell me about this before it happened to me. We're thinking maybe a glitch after level 40? Love your game!! Thank you!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198028352991', 'num_games_owned': 304, 'num_reviews': 55, 'playtime_forever': 285, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1615577530}
review: polishing, new map and adding more enemies will make this game sucessful. i can say valve game "the lab" had better graphic and smoother than this one

author: {'steamid': '76561197982987444', 'num_games_owned': 265, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1489527424}
review:
Although not the worst VR game out there is does have the distinction of being worse then the free bow game in Valves own Lab game. The animation of the enermies is just terrible, they need to do something other then run blindly towards the gate so it feels more interactive. I love it when they throw there axes as you have to duck out the way.
Also having enermies come from your blind spot may be a great idea on paper but it gets old fast.
The bow mechanics feel clunky compared to Valves own efforts. THis has alot with how you hold the controller as you cannot keep it upright all the time, you should be able to hold it at a more nature 45 degree angle in your hand.

I hope the developer fleshes it out abit so its more fun, using a bow in VR is a great idea when done right.
developer_response:
Hi!

I came to let you know that since 2017, the game has evolved a lot. 

Currently, you can expect new content, prettier visuals, better performance, and more interesting multiplayer mode. If this is still not enough, we plan to add even more maps and enemies in the future.

Maybe you should give Elven Assassin a second chance. We would be grateful.

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198055208113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 25532, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1160, 'last_played': 1534210857}
review: I cannot describe how much fun I have playing this game. I am astounded that it is this good and only a beta version. The details of the orcs, trolls, wyverns, and dragons are simply incredible.  One of the best parts is how dedicated the creators are with their regular updates, improving even the smalles details of the experience. I am very excited to see what is in store (...and literally in the store as is promised for the next update)!

author: {'steamid': '76561198300558024', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 6149, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2482, 'last_played': 1700321681}
review:
Awesome and underestimated in some parts very polished game ! The game principle is simple and not exclusively and I do like QuiVR, too, but it got to be emphazized :
- high WAF (wife accecpting factor)
-very immersive close-to-enemy experience with grunting orcs, flying dragons and more waving 
- extremely precise phisically based dragon-got-hit and (not only) falls to ground animations which are not repetetive
- Supersamling per advanced settings open VR without problerms (so far no in-game graph slider) - with my i6700K 980ti I reach 1.5
- additional scene in multiplayer mode is also accescible if there is no other player; this can also be played with rain added and includes heavy middleage wheapons
- Axes thrown at you and you must duck or step aside or do a quick estimation whether the axe would miss anyway/thrown at an obstacle ; all this with 3 D spatial audio of the rotating axe approaching ! very intense
- some moments of rest inbetween the waves because playing may become exhausting with some workout side effect

Dear developers, thank you a lot for this fine piece of work ! Maybe, sooner or later,  you could consider letting potential customers know of the beauty of the night level by providing a good video at the shopsite

For me 9/10 - the final point would come after some (randomy chosen ?) animation variety for the orcs

UPDATE: The dev are very savvy about updating accordingly to the thoughts and impressions of the customers.
And they are constantly delivering new beautiful maps, more dragons flying awesome nearby and much more.
Multiplayer works fast and easily and the new PvP deathmatch mode is a very good game for itself.
Just be prepared that the app is a bit heavy on the CPU side, too.
Replay value for wife and me since 2016 !!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198045356802', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 35, 'playtime_forever': 11, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1487208645}
review:
It's really hard for me to put into words. The graphics look nice but the way the guys move and die just seems... off... Maybe they just don't move enough as they walk, or their animations are too slow for the distance, or the animations are meant for faster speeds or something. I really don't know. 

Apart from that clunkiness that I can't properly express, dodging the axes takes too much time. They move too slow and take import time away that I could be shooting. I have to dodge all too far out of the way to dodge them as well. Maybe make them throw vertical rather than horizontal and perhaps a bit faster with sound so we know it's coming? 

It's also just "another wave shooter" without a unique dynamic to set it apart. QuiVR has us chasing down gates to close and healing them with skill-based shooting. I felt no rewards from killing guys apart from making it to another round and saying "yeah, I got to wave XX." And then if I want to beat my score, I have to sit through another 30 minutes of waves 1 through XX. QuiVR has dynamic difficulty so it increases with your skill so you don't have to wait forever to get your challenge on.

I also didn't feel the need to move from place to place. The center seemed like the best spot with no great advantage in other locations yet it still had blind places where I couldn't shoot at the guys and had to simply wait. 

I also could not hear the guys coming from behind me. So while I'm busy shooting guys, I have no idea there's like 10 behind me. Unless, after every shoot, I look back. Perhaps I'd get used to it, but I want to involve more senses.

The uniqueness, mainly, is in the graphics of orcs and locale. Make it something more than a wave shooter and it could be great. I like elves, I like elven-looking territories, I like shooting a bow, but it's not enough to make me feel the presence.

Lastly, I just didn't feel like the aiming was right. It always seemed to shoot far more to the right than where I was aiming. Again, this could be just that I'm used to QuiVR, but from The Lab to QuiVR I didn't get that same feeling. I have shot a bow in real life and I imagine that there should be a "correct" way to shoot in VR that matches exactly to real-life shooting. I didn't get that strange "not where I aimed" feeling with the other two games, and I really didn't want to retrain my brain with another bow in fear that it might mess up my aiming in QuiVR :-).
developer_response:
Hello,

There was some time since your last visit. We just want to let you know that there are things we improved.

From what you have mentioned back then: 

-We improved the animations (like orc/troll death and more).
-Dodging the axe now is more dynamic (there is also a throwing sound so you can be aware of it). You can avoid the axe using one of the new ice spells.
-There are new maps and new game mode which is PVP Deathmatch.
-There are Tournaments on the way to the game.

We also applied many improvements to the bow mechanics and shooting in our game. We know it wasn't perfect back then but we would love to know if the changes we have made make the game better for you.

Best regards

author: {'steamid': '76561197998320258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 629, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 124, 'last_played': 1640741350}
review:
Let me start off by saying upfront .......This is Well worth the 7.99 price tag. 

Comparing it to Quivr........

.......When I first played it I was going say its a better Value for the amount of content.......Then I Saw the Large Flying Fking Dragon Attacking the Castle (That you can shoot) I was defending and thought to myself......."Yeah this is way better than Quivr". The upgrade system is very simple and straight forward......something that is not explained very well in quivr. The bow mechanics are very similar to quivr except you don't have to reach over your shoulder to grab another arrow.....Which I like. I havent played a multiplayer game with other people yet so I really cant say it works or not but the way you move around is exactly like quivr. 

Architecture of the levels is great but the textures seem a little on the bland side.....not bad by any means.....they just don't pop out at me like i think they should......animations of the characters seems a little stiff like they were animated manually and not through motion capture.......None of this stuff is a deal breaker especially at this price point.

Looking through the games history the game devs are releasing regular updates......This is a very positive sign to me and makes me feel like I didn't waste my money on a cash grab.

With all the Garbage and shovelware for VR being dumped onto steam these days this is one of the few I put in the STRONGLY urge you to BUY category.....

.I think the devs are undervalueing their work here.........

author: {'steamid': '76561197971089992', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 575, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1548621593}
review:
Elven Assassin started out good, but the newly update bow mechanics added in early February 2017 makes it a worthy rival of Quivr.

While I love both games, I feel what Elven Assassin does better is truly make you feel like your lfe is in danger. The orcs fling axes at you that you must evade. The THUNK after they whiz past you really seems like it could remove  your head!

The level design is more closed in which means enemies progress quicker than in Quivr and in greater numbers which speeds up the game play. Couple that with having to duck and dodge axes, be prepared to break a sweat!

review:
There will be obvious comparisons to QuiVr. Both games are great-- what I like about this game is how the action is closer than quiVr. It's fun when the orcs get so close to you. Shooting the bow also feels great. Multiplayer is fun too although can get a bit laggy. 

Things I'd like to see improvements with are an easier way to use spells. I don't understand the point of holding the button down while using the arrow. Why not just press it once to activate?  

Also, incorporate some new ways the enemies move. Maybe some swarm you or run around so it's not just waves running in the same line to the gate.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970718032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 44, 'playtime_forever': 1870, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1058, 'last_played': 1631409517}
review:
Review Updated Apr 2017  (HTC Vive)

This game has come a LONG way in a short time!

Have not had a problem finding a multiplayer game, the spells and equipment add a lot to the game, and the community that I have met here of late have been superb to play with!

The dev team is still the greatest selling point of this game. VR is new ground, with many challenges to pioneer.  Tweaks bother major and minor have gone into this game, and it shows.  

The community is getitng some experience now, and some of us that don't move as fast as we used to are starting to be able to last more than 30 rounds without collapsing.

Easily my overall favorite VR title.


____________________________________________________________________________
Reviewed Dec 2016

I'll admit, straight away, that I am biased when it comes to donning elven armor and killing orcs with a bow.  Sign me up, no more questions asked.

Because this is a VR room-scale game, don't let the 6 hours played fool you... it would be far longer, but I get so intensely into this game that I wear myself out pretty quickly.  It's not just the drawing of the bow, but leaning out to get that last ditch long-shot on an orc rounding the corner, or dropping to a knee to duck an axe thrown by an orc who seems upset that you stuck an arrow in his buddy's braincase.

The graphics are good, the sound is fine, but the fact that the world around you disappears and you *become* an elven archer, defending a settlement or castle from onrushing hordes of orcs supplemented by ogres and dragons is really all that matters when it comes right down to it.

Full disclosure:  There are some rough edges, but in the grand scheme of early access titles they are very minor indeed.  You can jump in, right now, start slaughtering orcs alone or with up to 4 friends in co-op, and begin leveling up and learning magic skills such as flaming arrows, multi-arrows, short-lived traps that damage everything that passes, etc.   

This dev team is active, and since purchasing the game in July we've seen many fixes, and a great deal of content from a new and much different map, weather, mannable siege weapons, and the new level system that brings with it the aforementioned magic skills that supplement rather than over-power your character.  In the end, it still comes down to your personal accuracy and agility.

Stay hydrated, and prepare to wake up sore, because this game is intense.

author: {'steamid': '76561198116954829', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 372, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1589556283}
review:
This game has been simply great. When I first purchased my Vive I was immediately drawn into the longbow mini game included in the 'The Lab'. I searched Steam for similar content and stumbled into this gem. In the Elven Assassin you play as an archer trying to protect a fortress from orcs invaders. It's a wave based shooter, with the aim to to survive as long as possible. The game also includes a co-op multiplayer option, which I have  found the most enjoyable part of the game.

The bow mechanics are similar to those in 'The Lab', but a lot more refined. That being said it still needs some work, in particular with making aiming feel more natural. The game also gives you the ability to defend different areas of the fortress using a cleverly implemented teleport function, which requires the player to shoot the bow in the direction of the desired location.

In future updates I would love to see improved animations and audio. All the orcs seem to have the same unnatural 'plop' to the ground as they die. A little variation would go a long way. Also, the 'They're breaking in!' voice over could do with some nice voice acting, and perhaps some dramatic music.

All-in-all this game was a great experience, and definitely worth the cost compared to other Vive games. I look forward to seeing how this game develops with time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023693205', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 236, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1530096527}
review:
가능성이 있는 게임입니다.

'더 랩'에 있는 롱보우 게임보다 훨씬 세밀한 컨트롤을 요합니다.
왼팔에 컨트롤러를 쥔 각도. 
오른팔이 화살을 쥔 각도에 따라 화살의 경로가 영향을 받습니다.
덕분에 약간이라도 지쳐서 팔이 내려가기 시작하면 명중률이 확 떨어집니다.
그래도 그 부분은 리얼리티에 관한 몰입감을 줌으로 넘어갑시다.
멀티플레이도 재미있습니다.
지금까지 3명과 멀티를 해봤는데 서로 제스쳐를 보낼 수 있고 
음성으로 대화를 할 수 있다는 점이 재미를 더합니다.
아시아 서버에서 서로 잘 못하는 영어로 제스쳐로 의사소통한다는 점이 
또 다른 재미라고 볼 수 있습니다.

그러나 문제점도 있습니다.
첫째,
게임에 대해서 제대로된 설명이 게임 내부에 부재합니다.
어떻게 다른 포인트로 이동하는지
스킬은 어떻게 쓰는지
게임 내에서 찾을 수 없고 업데이트 내용을 통해 들어야 합니다.

둘째,
난이도 조절이 시급합니다.
아직까지는 화살과 스킬 구현에 치중이 되어 있는지 난이도가 고르지 못합니다.
중간부터 몬스터가 갑자기 파도처럼 밀려들어오는 경우가 있습니다.
그때는 단순한 ctrl + c , v  같은 몬스터 구성과 쏟아지는 물량은 
위급함보다는 단조로움, 지루함을 자극합니다.
 
셋째,
컨텐츠가 더 필요합니다.
한정된 몬스터, 그리고 몬스터를 단순히 스킬과 화살로만 막는다기 보다는
지형지물이나 이벤트를 통해 해치울 수 있게 만든다면 더 재미가 있겠죠.

그래도...
이 게임은 1만원 미만의 가격이고 
미리 해보는 게임이므로 앞으로 가능성이 무한히 많습니다.
그러나 지금 당장 이 게임을 하시게 될 분들은 2일에서 3일 이내에 
위와 같은 답답함을 느낄 것이라 생각합니다.
가능성에 대해서 투자하고 싶으시고 변해가는 모습을 흥미진진하게 지켜볼 수 있으시다면
좋은 게임이라고 생각합니다.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096412999', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 250, 'playtime_forever': 9712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4574, 'last_played': 1707062444}
review:
My 2 Minute video review:
https://youtu.be/Pjd228yIBnY

There are tons of bow and arrow games available in VR. And in my opinion, Elven Assassin is among the very best.

This was the first game that both my Dad and I purchased after we each bought our Vive’s over a year ago. Mostly for the multiplayer co-op play. And after all that time this is still the game we come back to over and over to play together.

The gameplay is fundamentally simple. Waves of Orcs, Trolls, and Dragons try to infiltrate the gate you're defending. 
Some orcs throw axes which you need to duck and dodge, and the giant Dragon will breath fire on your team if you don't kill it in time. 

The arrow mechanics are second to none. Any subtle way that you hold the bow or the arrow will influence the trajectory of where you shoot. You don't feel inhibited by the shooting mechanics at all.

There’s currently three maps to play in: Elven Town, Human Village, and Human Castle.
The castle is multiplayer only, but it features unique weapons like a catapult.

As you play more you will rank up and earn experience points which you can use to buy magical spells. After you buy spells you can summon them whenever you draw an arrow and use your bow hand thumb pad to select to spell you want (for me it’s the left hand), then the arrow you fire will create the spell. The spells are really handy for taking out large groups of orcs. 

I find this game enjoyable in both single player and multiplayer. And like I said before this is one of those games my Dad and I keep playing together over and over again. I highly recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016014044', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 3288, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1086, 'last_played': 1482883797}
review: This game is incredibly fun AND a workout! If I could buy one vr game this would be it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079748402', 'num_games_owned': 470, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 2166, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1692746197}
review:
Si vous avez aimé la défense de chateau dans The Labs, alors vous aimerez Elven Assassin. C'est le même principe, mais en plus joli, plus nerveux, jouable en coop et plus "tactique" car avec plusieurs placements différents.
Le jeu est encore en cour de développement et les dévs ont l'air d'avoir des idées en réserve et c'est tant-mieux.
Le seul reproche pour l'instant et sa très faible communauté, c'est des fois très long avant de trouver des partenaires pour jouer en coop.

This game is so fun! I like the auto arrow spawn. This is just a peek at wha seems like a great genre in room scale VR. Lets combo it with sword mechanics eventually with an area to teleport to for melee and the experience will be even better. So stoked to see where this goes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001218538', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 573, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 384, 'last_played': 1502684412}
review: This is one of my favorite games by far.  I have serious boundry issues in VR and find myself unable to play games where the enemies charge me - it's just WAY too intense and I panic.  This feels like a great balance to me, there is the interaction with the axes but nothing is lunging at my face or grabbing me. It's one of the games that I can play the longest in VR, it really drives me back to playing after a long day. I'm excited to see where this goes!

author: {'steamid': '76561198315859875', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 529, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1667860430}
review: El juego es lo que muestra el vídeo, una defensa por oleadas de la entrada de una aldea (de la que no sabemos nada) usando exclusivamente un arco e infinitas flechas. Pero hay algo mas, al jugarlo en modo multijugador cobra una nueva dimensión. La idea de cambiar de base dispaqrando a la base es simple y funciona muy bien. Pero le faltan novedades y al final siempre pierdes, no se acumula el progreso, por eso es como el día de la marmota. Solo desde una base se puede disparar a la entrada de la aldea. Tampoco me gusta que haya que apretar un botón para hablar. Supongo que lo irán mejorando, aún así me parece el mejor juego de arco que he jugado hasta ahora. La primera vez que te matan es bastante impactante.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034144245', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 2609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 237, 'last_played': 1663723580}
review:
This game is just flat-out fun. The basic premise is good, multi-player respawn in the next wave works well, physics are acceptable, and the bow system works. Dying in one shot in single player is a bit of a splash of cold water... perhaps some healing thing, or a helmet that can be bought?

In one day I've logged more time on it than any other game... with a big grin on my face.

Growth opportunities: different maps, different scenarios, different weapons, traps to release....maybe even the ability to place traps in certain areas to trigger. Orcs which shoot back, shields, maybe stuff we can place in the way as "booty" from previous waves.

Music isn't there yet, and a wider range of sounds would help the game in terms of a wider experience.

Strong recommendation from me!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020843932', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1473945086}

developer_response:
Hi!

Thank you for that comment. 

The game has changed a lot since your comment was published. We have improved the look of the game, implemented an extensive multiplayer mode that offers co-op, deathmatch, and tournaments, added new spells, improved the performance and fixed a lot of bugs. 

We have even more interesting content planned, such as new maps, opponents and new mechanics. 

Maybe try Elven Assassin again and let us know what you think. We would appreciate your feedback about the current state of the game!

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198003292839', 'num_games_owned': 1429, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1473960002}
review:
So, it's pretty much just another [i]"defense turret simulator[/i]" for VR.
Thing is, when it comes to archery games - and "defend the gate"-types in particular;
the [b]free[/b] one in "[i]The Lab[/i]" is already very good.
That means that any derivative games need to be at least *as* good, while also offering something more.
[i]Elven Assassin[/i] does neither.

First of all, aiming the bow feels very 'off'.
In trying to lining up a shot I found that I almost had to hold my hands right in front of my face - which doesn't work well at all given that neither the VIVE or the VIVE Controller is particularly small, so I ended up bumping myself in the face a couple of times.

There's also a huge lack of enemy variety and I couldn't see any alternative interactions ([i]like barrels you can shoot to blow up large groups, torches to set your arrows on fire, etc[/i]).
That just leaves a very basic archery game where, like I already mentioned, I didn't like the actual archery.

What [i]Elven Assassin[/i] has that [i]The Lab[/i] didn't is multiplayer.
Now, playing with a friend could make it somewhat more entertaining, but given what's here I'm not convinced even that would be enough.
developer_response:
Hello,

Since 2016 we applied many improvements to the bow mechanics and shooting in our game. We know it wasn't perfect back then but we would love to know if the changes we have made solved the aiming issues for you.

We've added some new enemies like dragons and trolls bosses, wyverns, elite orc warriors and more.

There is also a new game mode - PVP Deathmatch and Tournaments which are on their way! Those are very fun to play!

Best regards

author: {'steamid': '76561197966877172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1473916965}
review:
-Music is almost inaudible, sound effects are very poor quality
-There are only two enemies; they have the same models and animations, the only difference being that one has more health and sometimes throws axes at you
-The enemies all move at the same speed and have the same walking animation which doesn't match the pace they are moving
-You die in one hit and sometimes the enemy attacks are basically unavoidable
-Arrow aim feels slightly off compared to other archery games
-Did I mention the sound is garbage?
-The game makes you confirm that you want to quit the game over screen
developer_response:
Hello, 

There were many major updates since your last visit! New enemy bosses (like dragons, trolls), new maps, many spells, units (like wyverns, elite orc warriors), siege weapons, different types of equipment and more. There were sounds and performance improvements due to many patches. Also, we have a new PVP Deathmatch mode which is a lot of fun!

If you are still into VR games, maybe you consider checking back Elven Assassin? We would love to hear your opinion about those improvements!

Best regards

author: {'steamid': '76561198122708109', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 2012, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 109, 'last_played': 1563863404}
review: The Multiplayer is bad ass.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030765814', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7, 'last_played': 1582947286}
review:
I love QuiVr, and this looks like nearly identical play style with a few cool tweaks so of course it's worth trying.  The artwork is great, I like the concept of the Orcs going through the buildings, and the different colors used to signify who (in multiplayer) hit is a great idea.  It's really close to being a great game, but the bow physics just killed it for me and I ended up refunding.  

It's an archery shooting game.  No matter how pretty and cool the wrapping is, if shooting the bow doesn't feel good, it's a waste of money.  And unfortunately the aim is maddening in this.  I play Holopoint, QuiVr, and The Lab, they all are fine. Tweak the bow physics and I'll happily purchase again and try again.
developer_response:
Hello,

Since 2016 we applied many improvements to the bow mechanic and shooting in our game. We know it wasn't perfect back then but we would love to know if the changes we have made solved the aiming issues for you.

Best regards

author: {'steamid': '76561198002872077', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 75, 'playtime_forever': 2098, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1664445244}
review:
Comparisons to Quivr are obvious. In single player you're at the same spot and have to watch for Orcs passing you to get to the gate. Graphics are pretty good, so good in fact my wife fell over because she thought she'd step down closer to the path to get a better shot.
You can teleport to other towers in multiplayer but i couldn't find a game. Ping rates for closest servers are shown - nice idea.
   The biggest issue i had with was with the bow dynamics - it just didn't feel right and was hard to aim. That improved with practice but maybe the people of Elf town should do a deal with Quivr village and buy their bows from them. Don't trade the elven helmets for them tho' cos those things are useless. Maybe it's optimistic to think they'd stop an axe thrown by a 400lb Orc but perhaps they could do a deal with the fairies so you could get health hits every time you're whacked in the back of the head. One hit to the head and you're out of the game and it's hard to watch every sneaky Orc bastard.
  
   The American accented alert 'Theyre breaking in' was handy but maybe a European accent with helpful stuff like 'They are making rear entry'or 'Orcs coming down the back passage' would be better. 

This is a nice addition to the genre and a fun game for the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561197960798369', 'num_games_owned': 727, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 328, 'last_played': 1483816094}
review:
I wasn't too impressed by the gameplay footage but took a gamble on it anyway....I must say, you can't always judge a game by its footage. The gameplay is simple but addictive. The game also gets very hard, so I would highly recommend playing with people online. The orcs throw axes at you, which you have to dodge by squatting or jumping out of the way, which gets really exhausting but adds a lot of challenge and fun (By the end of my play session, my thighs, forearms, and butt were very sore haha). 

I can't recommend this game for the singleplayer experience, because you can die by one axe to the face, instead of just your outpost being destroyed (which kills the fun for me personally).

Multiplayer however, is a blast and I highly recommend it! (especially for the price)

Pros:
easily pick up and play
bow mechanics similar to "The Lab"
online play (4 player co-op!)
pretty good graphics
fast paced & challenging
teleport between posts
points scoring system, get points based on different variables (distance, headshot, etc.)
good workout

Cons:
getting hit by an axe in single player completely ends the game.
animations are clunky (i had an axe thrown at me while the orc wasnt facing me)
online play can be variously laggy (me: california, guy in minnesota: fine, me and guy in california: unplayable lag)
teleporting (there needs to be a different way to teleport, i kept shooting my arrows to cover someone and ended up teleporting to them.)


What i'd like to see:
respawn after getting hit with an axe instead of just ending the entire game.
more levels
more enemy types
addition of magic/special abilites
addition of traps
maybe an addition of a mage character that throws ice to slow down and fire to damage

author: {'steamid': '76561197961343982', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1474129834}

author: {'steamid': '76561198007482892', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 816, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 154, 'last_played': 1572211432}
review: Отличная игра

author: {'steamid': '76561198207632940', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1473605354}
review:
《精灵刺客|Elven Assassin》是一款中规中矩的射箭塔防游戏，没有任何花哨的东西。

由于玩家人数不多，合作模式也匹配不到人。

小怪会从4，5条路进攻，但是没有脚步声，很容易漏怪。

弓箭是唯一武器，射箭弹道和Longbow有点不一样，需要习惯

小怪在几波之后会攻击玩家，两飞刀就能打死，死了以后游戏结束。很难，真的很难！

多人模式也可以一个人玩，有几个点可以传送，传送方式是用箭射击传送点，有点别扭。。。

总体来说这个射箭塔防游戏并没有The Lab的Longbow，Trickster VR做的好，但是它有多人合作，是我梦寐以求的功能，然而现在匹配不到人一起玩。。。

author: {'steamid': '76561198165597609', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 73, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 68, 'last_played': 1474930923}
review: I regularly play quiVR and I think both Elven Assassin and quiVR are great in their own ways.  This ran with very few hickups, I've only played the multiplayer so far.  The dodging aspect is pretty great and pretty aggrevating.  I ran into a wall IRL dodging an axe (it was totally worth it).   I am very much looking forward to seeing what this game becomes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115534343', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 2638, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 451, 'last_played': 1703290122}
review:
Wow!  If you love Quivr, you will love this game.  It is not as ambitious as Quivr.  But the gameplay is quite fun and addicting.  I did not have the chance to try multiplayer.  But single player is a blast for me for me. I know I would be addicted to this game for a while.  The gameplay is very similar to Quivr, but one do not have the different variety of power the bow has.  Some enemy shoots back axe, which is quite nice.    

I think the price also make this game quite attractive.  Just buy it and you won't regret it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198033111227', 'num_games_owned': 979, 'num_reviews': 144, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1473634439}
review:
More or less like QuiVR but worse aiming.

This game offers better graphics, but at aiming and position of the bow and aiming, that's where it fails. Sorry, but i'm gonna wait with this game until it gets my money.
developer_response:
Hi!

We would like to inform you that the game has changed a lot since your review was published. 

We added new content, improved the look of the game, expanded multiplayer mode, improved performance, and fixed tons of bugs. In the near future, we will add new maps, interesting enemies, and fresh mechanics.

Would you like to try Elven Assasin again?

Best regards,
Kamil, Wenkly Studio

author: {'steamid': '76561198136492238', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1614205246}
review:
I really like this game so far! Very nice feeling of the bow. Good graphics and sound. It´s intense when enemies throw axes at you. Played with friends at my house and everybody loved it. 

Devs:
-Please make the arrows go faster. They feel a bit slow. If you crank the speed up a bit the feeling would be perfect. 
-Make some type of power ups for head hits or something. Like slow motion or multiple arrows in the bow like in trickster would be fun. 
- Also it would be great if you got some fun popup and sound when hitting heads. 
-Combo hits - when hitting x amount of anemies in the head you get extra points or power ups

review: Omg...Just bought this game and it's the most fun I've had on the vive to date.. Multiplayer is a blast too, getting the 4 point headshot or killing the last orc as he's at the door is so satisfying, graphics are amazing too, looking forward to what this game fully becomes!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198042720838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1473805900}
review:
Brilliant game, it is a lot like playing QuiVr but in some ways its better. Its got some bugs and the hand alignment should have a option to adjust them and the play area needs to be rotated by 180' but besides that its got nice visuals, smooth animations and online co-op.
Im sure the devs will release updates for the minor bugs and hopefully add some more options to tweak to allow a more personal feel to the game.
For the price its an easy 7.5/10 and a must have for any fan of this game style.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008259826', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1473572832}
review:
i hate to write negative reviews but this was the first game i refunded. the game concept is simple as are the mechanics. the art is fair especially considering its VR and most games out are low poly styles. however we didnt get past 5 minutes of playing before being unable to play. tried solo first and the first wave got bugged and the 2nd wave never started. then we tried multiplayer and upon loading in we were fine, got 2 arrows off then our bow turned into a controller and we could not shoot arrows anymore. we just stood and watched the others having a good time. 

like said, game itself is ok, but it was too broken for us to play it. hope the devs iron things out, might check it out later down the road.
developer_response:
Hello,

We would like to let you know that since 2016 there are many things which we've changed and improved in our game.

Maybe you consider checking it out after that time?

Best regards

author: {'steamid': '76561198000673286', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 507, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 188, 'last_played': 1491125796}
review:
Update: Many people are trying to say this game ripped off QuiVR, however development of this game started BEFORE the QuiVR demo was released for SteamVR, and the only thing that makes the game similar is the use of a bow, and having Orcs as an enemy (which is canon for fantasy anyways). I personally like this game more than QuiVR and dodging incoming attacks is not a part of QuiVR, however both games are great - there doesn't have to be just one archery fantasy game. Also, it seems a tad unfair to me that half of these reviews are from players with 5-8 minutes or less played.

Original review:
I don't often write reviews but I felt compelled to write one tonight after playing this game because I'm glad to support it!

This game is a pure bow game, with excellent pullback mechanics. The bow responds well, aims well, and just feels nice. Less like Holopoint and more like the tower defense from The Lab (both great games).

It's also worth mentioning it can be a bit of a workout when you have to start dodging axes, luckily it didn't take me too long to learn and somehow I squeezed out the number three spot on the leaderboards (for now) haha.

If you're on the fence, pick it up, it's easily as fun as Holopoint and right now on this sale it's almost just a third of the price. You won't be disappointed!

I did not receive this game for free, it was just a random pickup when searching for games via the "release date" option on the steam store.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009667346', 'num_games_owned': 812, 'num_reviews': 54, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1473577098}
review:
優點(吐槽點)：
☆把QuiVr的浮空鐵頭盔與木弓複製過來以後鍍了金
☆把QuiVr的射箭傳送系統完全複製了過來
☆把QuiVr的大廳、字體完全複製了過來
☆這游戲中唯一的原創：怪物會向你丟斧頭，你會死


缺點(還是吐槽點)：
▼這款作品90%抄襲了QuiVr
▼這種品質還敢拿出來賣錢給QuiVr的作者看
▼連綫優化極差，怪物與投射物斧頭會瞬移根本沒辦法打
▼怎麽沒有把QuiVr原創的的升級系統也一起抄過來啊？


整體評分：
0/10
這款游戲應該要壓倒性負評，我個人是絕對無法容忍這種抄襲的行爲，建議各位買下來給負評後退費。


不敢相信居然有人可以這麽無恥地把別人辛苦開發的游戲完全抄過來，然後大剌剌的賣錢！
去玩具店偷玩具還吧偷來的玩具放在門口賣？
真的是夠了，吃我的退費吧！這種行爲完全證明了你們沒有絲毫創意與開發能力！玩得我一肚子氣！

被這款游戲抄襲的原作QuiVr(試玩版是目前的完整版)：
http://store.steampowered.com/app/489380/

9/12 更新
http://steamcommunity.com/games/489380/announcements/detail/582476975920663936
QuiVr作者在下方回應表示Elven Assassin的游戲代碼采用了他以前公開貢獻給VR開發社群的舊代碼，并表示他覺得競爭是好的，他們會更努力讓QuiVr成爲更好的射箭游戲。

author: {'steamid': '76561197970719258', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 3232, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1711148248}
review: What a great game for your inner Legolas!  I had a blast playing with four people to defend the city making it up to wave 27.  Dodging the axes is tricky and really does interrupt your defense.  Nice job!  Voice chat was clear and the hand gestures were fun.  I really like the point system where the points you get from each hit are color coded.  Extra points for long shots or head shots.  Very nice!  It does have a few rough edges.  Orcs ocassionally got stuck on terrain and some shots were a bit laggy but nothing too bad.  I really look forward to future features from this game!  (More maps, please?)
